loans.name: Jose Tranquilino

texts.en: Jose lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras where he runs a small convenience shop. He wakes early each day and runs the store seven days a week. Jose is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase merchandise for the shop. He would like to continue working with Prisma in the future to keep growing his business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, corn, cornmeal, snacks, candy, soft drinks, juice, milk, eggs, bread, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with four children. Marites is 38 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Marites sells canned goods, noodles, soap, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more goods such as canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

Marites has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Marites hopes to have a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel is 42 years old and married. He doesn’t have a child yet, but hopes to have one soon.

Jovel is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice and corn crops for eight years. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month selling his harvest to his community.

Jovel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 25-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and two children. Two years ago, he opened a small shop where he started selling mobile phones, cosmetics, and perfumes. The young man's newly-started business needs so much support to move forward. So today, he is requesting to borrow $3000 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his store’s inventory of recharge cards and to add necessary decoration to keep his shop attractive to new customers. This is Abbass' fourth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loans reflected positively on his business growth and on his family's social and financial situations. He notes that the loan will help him fulfill his objectives and will positively impact his business growth and development the same way as the previous ones did.
His shop is located next to a hospital, which provides him with an increase in the number of customers, and is not dependent on the villagers and neighbors. He hopes to keep on expanding his business to provide his family with the good standard of living they deserve to have.

loans.use: To increase his store inventory by adding a new mobile phone and accessories collection, and to add necessary decoration

loans.name: Adali

texts.es: Adalid, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 35 años de edad, es mas madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, ella es estilista, tiene su propio salón de belleza, llevar 7 años con este negocio. Inicio con capital propio, a la edad de 17 años le empezó a gustar trabajar en el área de belleza, se inscribió en una academia para aprender a ser estilista con la fe y la esperanza de algún día tener su propio negocio y así lo hizo, de este negocio sobrevive y además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos que la ayudan atravez de remesas cuando pueden. Ella tiene  expectativa  de agrandar su negocio. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para comprar cosméticos, tintes, secadora, planchas. Con esta inversión podrá comprar parte de las herramientas  que necesita para trabajar, surtir su inventario de cosméticos y sobre todo brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. En sus planes futuros quiere remodelar su salón de belleza, acondicionarlo mejor y convertirlo en una academia de belleza.
texts.en:
Adali lives in the city of Estelí.  She is 35, and a single mother of two children, ages 13 and 7.  She is a hairdresser and has her own beauty salon where she has been in business for seven years.  She started her business with her own money at the age of 17.  Since she enjoyed working in cosmetology she enrolled in an academy to become a beautician with the faith and hope that one day she would have her own business, and in fact she did.

Her source of income is from the business and from the help she receives from her brothers who send her money whenever they can.  She hopes to expand her shop and is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics, hair color, a hair dryer and hair straighteners.  With this investment she will be ble to buy part of the tools she needs for her work.  It will increase the stock of cosmetics so she can provide better service to her customers.  Her future plans include remodeling the salon to set it up as a beauty academy.

loans.use: To pay for , hair color, a hair dryer and .

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson lives peacefully with his family in the Philippines. He is 31 years old and married. He has two children who inspire him to work hard. Wilson’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in life. Wilson has run a hog-raising business for two years. He earns approximately P2,000 a month in his business, which he uses for household expenses. He wants to earn a higher income from the business to save some of it for the future of his family. Wilson is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance. Wilson wishes to expand and maintain his business for his continued source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance.

loans.name: Quoc

texts.en:
Quoc is 37 and married with a son. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City. His wife earns money by cooking meals for people in their community. 

For the past nine years, Quoc has supported his family by selling candies to many small general stores near his home. This gives him a regular income to cover his family's expenses and his child's education fees. 

He would like to get a loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of candies from wholesalers to sell. He hopes that this will enable him to attract and serve more customers.

Quoc hopes that he will increase his income and help improve him family's living conditions through the loan.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and better quality of candies to sell.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is a very hard working woman who has practiced mixed farming for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 33 years old, married and she has three children.

Loise is applying for her first loan. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and lives in Ilayang Pulo Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronildo, who is employed, and is the mother to their two children, both of whom are studying in college. Marilyn, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marilyn makes a living by selling ornamental plants. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and orchids. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors, and the community. Marilyn has been in this business for ten years and earns a minimum of 700 PHP in daily sales. 

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to continue operating her business. She will buy supplies such as plastic, fertilizer, pots, seedlings, baskets, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Marilyn hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends her group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gardening and plant nursery supplies

loans.name: Toribio

texts.en:
Toribio is 50 years old, married to Perla, and together they are raising three children who are in school. His family lives a less fortunate lifestyle. To make a living, Toribio cultivates rice as the source of his income. He plants and harvest rice. Sometimes, his spouse also helps him in transplanting rice seedlings to the farm. According to him, rice farming requires patience and determination. He wants to achieve more crop production so he is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy pesticides and fertilizers to ensure a good crop in his rice field.

In the future, he would like to continue generating good income from his farming business. Toribio also promises to pay the said loan amount on time.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to ensure a good crop in his rice field.

loans.name: Love Joy

texts.en: Love Joy is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 32, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a pharmacy shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings) she wants to purchase medicines to sell at the pharmacy. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to sell at the pharmacy.

loans.name: Bebie Jane

texts.en:
Bebie Jane is a married woman and she has one child. She is 23 years old and resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Bebie Jane operates a business raising crops, specifically planting and harvesting mangoes for sale. She has worked in this field for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as baskets and nets. Bebie Jane has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, she wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as baskets and nets.

loans.name: Savali

texts.en:
Savali, 26 years old, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 6 years. He describes himself as an ambitious man. 

For the last two years, he has been providing transportation services to residents in a competitive place. His business challenge is the weather, especially when it rains, as the roads are impassible. 

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts for the motorbike. Savali's hope and dream is to own another motorbike. In the next five years, his goal is to buy a van to add more transportation services.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn, aged 32, a mother of three school-age children, has been living in Takhmao town, where working in agriculture is common for local people. To earn a living, she grows rice and some types of vegetables, earning approximately $5.00 per day to meet the needs of her family. Her husband is a security guard for a private company; however, he also uses some free time to help Sorn on their farmland. 

Now Sorn needs some funds from Kiva to start planting her dry-season rice again for the year. This is her third loan from HKL. With the previous loans, Sorn has never made any late payments and she has paid them off successfully. She said this loan is very important to sustain her agricultural business.

loans.use: to start planting her dry-season rice again.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand I Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND I est un groupement composé de dix  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupement. Hoboudé Carole, la représentante du groupement (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 23 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau universitaire. Hoboudé Carole est mariée à un certain Firmin. Le couple a deux enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Hoboudé Carole vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Hoboudé Carole vend des vêtements de façon ambulante depuis sept ans. Hoboudé Carole vend également des bijoux ce qui lui de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer au bien n'être de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Hoboudé Carole s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Hoboudé Carole sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DIEU EST GRAND I un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des vêtements et des bijoux.

loans.name: Heremakono 5 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO 5  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le mais avec SETOU la 2ème personne de la droite à la gauche sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 53 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children of whom the 3 are now at their adult and 1 at school age. Thelma earns a living from pork barbecue vending business for 1 year and earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing kilos of meat, toccino mix and barbecue sticks for her existing business. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Thelma hopes to have a bigger stall for her barbecue business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing kilos of meat, toccino mix and barbecue sticks

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is mother of four children, 17, 11, 9 and 2 years of age, is married and lives in a small house in the city of Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo Leon. Their needs have significantly increased with the cost of the education of their children and her husband\'s salary is not enough to cover the costs comfortably. This is why 5 years ago Benita started to make ladies\' shoes, a business that has permitted her to put her family and husband ahead. Now she requires a loan of $250, as she is going through some economic problems and is the only way to be able to maintain what she has built with so much effort.

She plans to repay the full amont of the said loan in a term of 3-6 months. Things have not been easy for Benita and her family and with much effort they have earned what they have. Now the well being and education of their children is in jeopardy. You can help them materialize Benita\'s dream of seeing her children finish their studies, that is the only inheritance she can give them. You can help them, don\'t doubt it. They will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Benita es madre de 4 hijos de 17, 11, 9 y 2 años de edad, es casada y vive en una pequeña casita de la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Las necesidades han aumentado mucho con lo gastos de la educación de sus hijos y con el salario de su esposo no se alcanzan a cubrir satisfactoriamente. Es por todo ello que hace 5 años Benita comenzó a fabricar zapatos para dama, con esta actividad ella ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ayudar a su esposo. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 250 DLLS, pues atraviesa por algunos problemas económicos y es la única manera de poder sostener lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha construido.

Ella planea cubrir el monto total de dicho préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses. Las cosas no han sido nada fáciles para Benita y su familia y con mucho esfuerzo han logrado lo que tienen. Ahora su bienestar y la educación de sus hijos esta en peligro. Tú puedes ayudar a cristalizar los sueños de Benita, ver a sus hijos culminar sus estudios, que es la única herencia que les puede dejar. Tú puedes ayudarlos, no lo dudes, ellos te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase equipement

loans.name: Zia Gul

texts.en:
Zia Gul D/O Rajab, 54, is married to Yaqoob and her family contains 4 members. She is living in District 3 of Kabul City. Zia Gul is not educated because her family didn't want girls to go to school and get an education and she was married at a young age.

She has the business of animal husbandry and she has been doing this business for 15 years. She sells milk, yogurt and cheese at the market and overcomes some of her financial problems. She is at her first loan cycle and has bought another cow with her loan. She is happy with the loan and she says that she hopes to expand her business and help her husband financially.

She wants to go ahead with the loan and after the first cycle, when she borrows a bigger amount, she plans to make a shop where she can sell the dairy products she gets from home.

loans.use: To buy cow

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Chorn T. is 32 years old and works as a tailor in Phnom Penh.  He can earn $10/day in his business, and his wife helps out at his shop.  They have one young child, and they are hoping to gain more income to support him through school.  This loan will be used to purchase more clothes for the business.  In the future, Chorn T. is confident that his business will continue to grow so that he can properly support his child.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for his tailoring business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has lived her whole life in the presence of fish. Her father was a fisherman, and caught trout in the local rivers near Trujillo, Peru, where she grew up. When she turned 20 years old, Maria opened a small “cevicheria,” adjacent to her home, and served the trout, cooked without heat by marinating the meat in limejuice. Seven years ago, her husband abandoned her for another woman, and Maria was left to care for her 3 children alone.

Deciding to make a fresh start, Maria moved to Ayacucho, Peru, where she had distant relatives. She used her savings to rent a counter section at the central market, where she sells her ceviche and sodas to up to 50 customers a day. She can be found at her stall, which is equipped with a sink and preparation area, 7 days a week, from about 9 am until quite late at night, or until her supply of fish runs out. Dressed in the traditional white chef hat and apron, Maria exudes experience and professionalism. A steady stream of customers visits her kiosk, and business really picks up during the lunch hour. She serves a generous portion of the diced fish, with potatoes, onions, and a lettuce garnish.

For her next loan, Maria hopes to receive US$500. For now, her stall is modestly equipped with the most basic utilities. She would use the money from this loan for a small refrigeration device that she could install under the preparation counter. For now, Maria must store the fish, which comes frozen twice a week from Lima, at her home, and prepare the ceviche there as well. With refrigeration at her kiosk she would not have to carry the heavy dishes to work, and would be able to avoid the risk of running out of food on a busy day.

Maria V. belongs to a village bank called “Ayni” which is a quechua (native language) word that means “I help you now, you help me later”. So Maria has friends in her village bank like Benita Sierra. Maria and Benita are expecting together a total loan of US$ 900.

loans.use: To purchase a small refrigeration device

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is single and has a young daughter. They live in her parents house. To be able to make progress with her family, she decided to undertake a business selling groceries. She arranged a room in the house, and started with very few products, but thanks to the good service she offered she has been able to grow her business, adding the variety of products to meet her clients demands.

Right now, Elizabeth needs a loan of $275 to buy merchandise, which she hopes will improve her business and incorporate the sales of other products very much in demand in her area. She has committed to repay the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business if you decide to help. Please help those who need it most. Elizabeth and her family appreciate it very much.

Elizabeth es soltera, tiene una pequeña hija y viven en casa de sus padres. Para salir adelante con su familia decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de abarrotes, acondicionando una habitación, comenzó con muy pocos productos pero gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha podido hacer crecer su negocio, incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Elizabeth necesita un crédito de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía con lo que espera surtir mejor su negocio e incorporar la venta de otros productos que son muy demandados en su localidad, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a quien mas lo necesita, Elizabeth y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Neba Florence

texts.en:
Florence and her five kids are suffering from a broken home and, as a result, have gone through a lot of suffering, including lack of food to eat and lack of school fees.

Motivated by these problems, Florence became a GHAPE member. with a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to invest in the business she already runs, that of selling drugs and cosmetics and running a telephone booth. The profit will enable her pay the school fees for her children.

She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: To purchase materials for construction of a booth, buy drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Youn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Youn, 36, and her husband have been married since 1988. She has three children; two sons and one daughter. Her first son is in business in raising ducks, her daughter is working in a garment factory, and her youngest son is studying in local school. Youn and her family are living along National Road number Five about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of a grocery store and selling vegetables at her house since 2003. Her husband does growing rice. She tries to save some money from her income to buy cows for her husband to grow rice. After getting loans from Maxima many times, her life is getting better and better.

Now she is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $250. She will use this loan to buy grocery items for reselling in her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying grocery items for reselling

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza is a mother who has put forth much effort and work to improve her home. She is a native of the small town of Capachica, and with the wish to progress in the company of her beloved family, she decided to leave the town which saw her birth. Currently, she has taken root in the city of Juliaca, where she has a small restaurant inside the market, Cerro Colorado. She began this work ten years ago. At first, she worked as a cook in a restaurant. After discovering her talents for cooking, she decided to save and acquire adequate means to open her own restaurant. Thanks to this job, she can grant her dear children secondary education and soon, higher education. The wish of this hard working mother is to finish the construction of her humble abode in order to grand stability and security to the members of her beloved family. We are making her petition possible so that soon she may realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Nicolaza es una madre que a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo fue sacando adelante su hogar, ella es natural del pueblito de Capachica, con el deseo de progresar en compañía de su querida familia, decidió partir del pueblo que la vio nacer. Actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca, donde tiene un pequeño restaurante en el interior del mercado, Cerro Colorado. Ella inició esta labor hace 10 años, en un principio trabajando como cocinera en un restaurante, después de descubrir sus cualidades para la cocina decidió ahorrar y conseguir los medios adecuados para abrir su propio restaurante, gracias a este oficio puede brindarle a sus queridos hijos estudios secundarios y dentro de poco estudios superiores. El deseo de esta esforzada madre es terminar de construir su humilde domicilio para brindarles estabilidad y seguridad a los miembros de su amada familia. Posibilitemos su petición para que dentro de poco pueda cristalizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Injection of capital to finish construction of her humble abode.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Señora Beatriz is 23 years old and is a part of the communal Bank “Jesús Maria.” She is the mother of a four year old son, who has become her primary motivation and source of daily strength. Beatriz makes a living selling produce such as plantains and tomatoes. She has been in the business of selling regional produce for some time, and has a goal of increasing and improving her business so that down the road she might have her own bodega (shop). With your help, Señora Beatriz will reach her goals quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

La señora Beatriz de 23 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal “Jesús Maria”, ella es madre de un niño de 04 añitos de edad, el mismo que se ha convertido en el principal motivo y motor de su trabajo y esfuerzo diario. Ella se dedica a la venta de plátanos maduros, tomates entre otros productos de pan llevar. Se dedica a la venta de sus productos regionales desde hace tiempo, con el propósito de crecer y mejorar su negocio para más adelante tener su bodega.Con tu ayuda la señora Beatriz logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Business Improvements

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 40 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 12-26. Asha is a food seller; she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $280 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn Y. lives in Kraing Metrey Village in the Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of one child, who studies in state school. She is a subsistence farmer, cultivating her crops in a small field in the village. Her husband, Chum Ourm, pictured on the right, works with her on the rice field. With respect to their business, Mrs. Vorn Y. relies heavily on weather conditions and at times the weater conditions are extremely adverse. Since the monsoon season is fast approaching, it is more convenient and practical to grow rice at this time of the year. Unfortunately, Mrs. Vorn Y. does not have any draft animals to plow the rice field, so she is hereby seeking a loan to buy cows for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase draft animals (cows) to plow the rice field.

loans.name: René

texts.es:
Consuelo is a woman who works day to day with the goal of providing for her 12-year-old son's well-being and giving him the tools to make him successful in the future. Every since she was very little she worked as a merchant and has inherited the art of selling from her parents. It brings her a lot of pleasure to dedicate herself to this activity and she hopes to increase her work area and the amount of candies, snacks and beverages she offers.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Consuelo es una mujer que día a día trabaja con el objetivo de otorgarle bienestar y las herramientas necesarias a su hijo de 12 años para que éste pueda alcanzar el éxito en su vida futura. Ella desde muy pequeña a estado ligada a la labor mercantil y ha heredado de sus padres el arte de vender, le complace mucho dedicarse a esta actividad y está decidida a mejorar su espacio de trabajo y la cantidad de los productos que ofrece.

loans.use: Increase her capital to offer a larger amount of candies / Incremento de capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de dulces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru:
Shokir M. lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has 6 children. He has technical education and works on a collective farm. Besides he is engaged in agriculture. He grows rice and sells it at the market to wholesale buyers. He uses the profit for his family. Shokir would like to get a loan for buying seeds and fertilizers. He will be able to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродов Шокир житель города Турсун-Заде. Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. Работает в колхозе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Сеет рис .Урожай продает на базаре оптовым покупателям. Прибыль использует для семьи. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для покупки семян и удобрений. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida Baji is the wife of Mr. M. Ahmed, who has worked in an office named Dry-Port as a custom officer for the last 23 years. Zubaida Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living in an area named "Jani Pura chowk" in Lahore, Pakistan, for the last 10 years. She owns a three-room brick house. She is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons. Her eldest son is a salesman and makes embroidered dresses. She successfully completed her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material (cloth, thread, embroidery machine) for her son's embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery business

loans.name: Juan Ortiz

texts.es: El señor Juan Ortiz, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y sus otros dos hijos le ayudan en el desempeño de su negocio, siendo este la comercializacion menor de chatarra como es lata, aluminio, hierro, teniendo un pequeño negocio que su sueño es poder incrementar  y crecer economicamente al mismo tiempo generar fuentes de empleo. Ademas de esta actividad el señor se dedica al comercio de cerdos en pie actividad que tambien realiza en conjunto con un hijo. Su proposito es poder establecerse como un acopiador de chatarra dentro de lso mas fuenrtes en el mercado para ello requiere un capital lo suficientemente para establecerse en el mercado o negocio de chatarra.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Ortiz, is 56 years old, is married and has 4 children of which two are already married and his other two sons help him in carrying out the business. Through his small business he resells scrap metal such as tin, aluminum and iron. His dream is to be able to enhance and grow economically while generating jobs. In addition to this activity, Mr. Ortiz is a wholesaler of pigs which he also performs together with his son. His goal is to establish himself as a scrap metal collector within the strongest market but this requires enough capital to become established in the scrap metal market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. T. has been a member of FINCA Perú for six years. She lives with her partner and their four children aged 16, 14, 8, and 1. Elizabeth sells grains that she hauls on a cart to numerous local fairs. Additionally, she makes children's clothing upon request.

With her loan of 1,000 soles ($350 USD), Elizabeth plans to invest in her business by purchasing wheat, corn, beans, soybeans, flaxseed, cheese, material for children's clothing, thread, and needles. She plans to use her income to help her children continue their education. She would also like to own her own home and a store where she can sell her products in a fixed place instead of having to travel.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es: Melquíades tiene 40 años, vive solo ya que esta divorciado de su pareja, pero ayuda a la manutención de sus 4 hijos Tania de 13, Joel de 6, Neftali de 4 y Jose de 3. El ser Albañil le ha traído muchas gratificaciones, ya que le permite mantener a sus hijos, los cuales necesitan de su apoyo. Melquiades realiza este trabajo desde hace ya 5 años, siendo  lo mas difícil de este que no es un trabajo seguro , sino esporádico ya que cuando acaba la construcción de alguna obra queda ese lapso de tiempo sin trabajo, por lo cual también ha decidido dedicarse a la carpinteria para asegurar sus ingresos. Melquiades esta es su segundo ciclo de su primer prestamo con micro finanzas Prisma y es muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero del prestamo comprara herramientas para su trabajo de albañil y para el de carpintero, para así poder forjarse un futuro mejor. n
texts.en:
Melquiades is 40 years old and he lives alone, having been divorced from his partner. But he helps to support their 4 children, Tania who is 13, Joel who is 6, Neftali who is 4, and Jose who is 3 years old. Being a laborer has brought him many benefits, especially because it helps him support his children, all of whom need his care. Melquiades has carried out his occupation for the past 5 years. The hardest part about his job is that is it not steady employment, but ready sporadic. After he completes a construction project there is a lapse of time he is without work. It is in those times that he decided to do carpentry to supplement his income. Melquiades is currently on the second cycle of his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is very punctual with his payments. With the funds from this loan he will purchase tools for his work as a laborer and as a carpenter, so that he may build a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work as a laborer and as a carpenter.

loans.name: Maria Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Maria, socia del BC “La Mujer Riojana””, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de  Rioja. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos que aún están estudiando y además son la razón de lucha constante por que ella los cría sola. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en una de las calles principales de la ciudad como también en las afueras de los colegios.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará chocolates en cajas, galletas de diferentes marcas y sabores, caramelos, chicles de diferentes marcas, plátanos y aceite para la preparación de chifles.  

María es una mujer emprendedora, quien está agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la confianza que le dio al brindarle un préstamo que la ayudará a crecer en su negocio. Más adelante desea contar con un local para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria, part of the communal bank The Riojana Woman, lives in the San Martin region, province of Rioja. She is 42 years old and is the mother of two children, who are still in school and are the reason for her constant (economic) battle, since she is their sole caregiver. She sells candy in one of the city's main streets as well as near the schools. With this loan of $425, which will be paid back in six months, she will buy boxed chocolate, different brands and flavors of cookies, caramels, different brands of gum, bananas, and oil for preparing snacks. Maria is a very enterprising woman, who is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for their confidence in giving her this loan that will help her grow her business. Someday she hopes to have a place for her business so she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and other items

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua K. is 54 years old. She has lost her husband long ago. Three of her four children have completed school and are now independent. The last born is in senior high school. Akua has provided for her family ever since she lost her husband. She trades in secondhand textile materials. She deals mainly in bedspreads. She buys the textiles in bales from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells in the local market. She has managed this business for nine years. She desires to buy textiles in bales so that she can trek to markets in nearby towns. Akua belongs to the All Nation Trust Bank group. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy secondhand textiles in bales for resell

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn I. was born in 1948 and he now lives in Sampong Chey village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. In this plantation, he does not earn enough income to provide a better life for his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy 0.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Tith Noeurn, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Oeurn I. has five children, two of whom are laborers while the others are employed in the garment factory, and the remaining child is attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy 0.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Adepegba

texts.en: Adepegba O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells clothes and she is a hair stylist.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at M., 50, and her husband, Mr. Nat Mak, 49, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1986 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of their children is a silk weaver and the other children attend school.

Sam-at has been a silk weaver for 30 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Besides weaving, Mr. Nat Mak raises pigs as well. Sam-at is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy feed for raising pigs

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Mebo has owned a small medical store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $45. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more medicine for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mebo is 39 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 14, and 9.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sabina, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! 

Angela K. is 38 years old from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 11 and 17. Angela has been running a poultry business since 2006. She raises kuku, which means chicken in Swahili. This is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients and is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, poultry raising requires little start-up capital and you can start with one or two, and slowly add more to your flock or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space- they can run in your garden or compound. Thirdly, they produce eggs while being raised for meat and the eggs can be sold to provide additional  income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at her business seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Angela currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Angela thanks you for your support!

	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Flavia's Group

texts.en:
N. Flavia, a very methodical, hard-working lady, operates a business buying fresh animal blood, shells and bones from which she makes chicken feed. She employs people to go to slaughter houses “lufula” to collect the fresh blood in cans; she then boils all of her ingredients from Ugachick in Gayaza as an independent. Once done, she sells to Ugachick itself although the payments take two weeks to come through; this is one reason she also sells to other firms that pay instant cash for her to remain in business.

Flavia is grateful for her loans because she has been able to pay school fees for her four children singlehandedly after the death of her husband, and now they are out of school and operating their own businesses. She currently cares for three orphans attending school, all the children of her late sister but abandoned by their father upon his remarriage.

Thanks to previous loans received, Flavia was able to build her own house, but she is now requesting another loan to buy windows and doors for her house to replace the polythene paper coverings; the balance of the loan will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buying windows and doors for her house.

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf E. is a 37-year-old master barber who has run his business for the last 10 years. He is married and has two children. Rauf started his business after he went to special barber school and since that time he has been a master barber for men. Rauf says that he dedicates his life to his adorable children and would like to provide them the best future. For this purpose he applied for a $1,200 loan to improve his work conditions and to purchase new barber tools.

loans.use: Improve work conditions and purchase new barber tools

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel vive en la calle  Antofagasta de la zona  Pasankery de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a sus hijos los cuales son mayores de edad y poseen sus propias familias. 

El actualmente es jubilado de la alcaldía, y trabaja como chofer asalariado de transporte publico en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construcción para la reparación de parte de su muro y techo de baño en su domicilio.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Ezequiel lives on Calle Antofagasta in the Pasankery zone in the city of La Paz. He lives with children. They are grown and have their own families. He is currently retired from the town hall. He works as a salaried public transportation driver in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction materials to repair part of a wall and the ceiling in the bathroom in his home. This is his third loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with one child. She sells various decoration items at the central market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her profit is 3,500 UAH per month.

Oksana has been in this business for 14 years. It is a small city and people know each other quite well. Being an honest and just nice person, Oksana was able to win many clients who became her repeated customers. Many people buy items from her to give to someone as birthday gifts as well as to decorate their own houses and apartments. 

Oksana would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase the assortment. Her business goal is to open a small shop to sell similar items and have better conditions for her customers.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 60 years old. She is married with five children. Two children are currently out of school and independent, whiles the rest are still in school. She is very committed to her work and very resourceful to her family  because she believes the children are her future hope. 

She sells smoked cow skin in the community market where she lives. Smoked cow skin is a popular source of meat used in preparation of sauces and favourite local dishes like "waakye" and "banku". She purchased stock of cow skin from herd men in northern region of Ghana and has been in business for three years now. Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, saves her from frequent traveling. She requests a loan to buy more smoked skin to upgrade her inventory. She desired to provide her children with quality to give them better career. she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat

loans.name: Hadjah Nalongo’S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is a leader of a 5-member loan group. She is a 33-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of  5 and 16 years. All of her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she lives with nine people. Hadjah takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. 

Hadjah stays in Nalukolongo where she runs a ladies saloon in one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transportation to and from shopping because she buys from Kampala city shops. Hadjah sells to an average of  20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and her home.  She has been in this business for the past 6 years. 

Hadjah has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan, and is still working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more food for her restaurant. Hadjah aspires to see her business grow bigger and own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restauarnt

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 57-year-old trader. Married with ten children, unfortunately she lost four of them as time went by. Currently she has five boys and one girl of whom some are schooling.

Theresa believes in hardworking and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals like maize and gari. Gari is produced from cassava.

Theresa started her business twelve years ago with just a small amount of working capital. Through this, she has been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and gari to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country.

Theresa believes that, with the loan, she can buy more bags of maize and gari grains from the farmers rather than from middlemen who retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize and gari

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. En 1999, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de pagnes de différentes catégories. Elle exerce cette activité de manière ambulante. Ce commerce lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari électronicien, pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent ses pagnes à des femmes fonctionnaires d’Etat et des salariées du secteur privé. Actuellement elle a un besoin urgent de renouveler son stock ; c’est dans cet objectif qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au Grand Marché de Lomé 15 pagnes de qualité Wax Hollandais, 10 pagnes Hitarget 15 pagnes Soso. Le reste du prêt lui permettra d’assurer ses frais de transport vers le lieu d’approvisionnement.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes

loans.name: Mary Kerubo

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and married to Samuel who is a civil servant working for one of the goverment ministries. They have two children, Charles and Catherine who are 25 and 23 respectively.

Mary runs a retail shop in a densely populated area with middle level customers who are loyal to her due to her good rapport with them. 

Mary has no credit history and was introduced to KADET staff when they conducted a marketing promotion in her area of operation and after organizing some business partners they formed a group where she is the founder of the group.

She has applied for a loan which she plans to increase her stock including rice and soft drinks which is in high demand at the moment and with the extra profits she plans to pay school fees for her daughter Catherine.

Mary's hopes and dreams are to expand her business to a wholesale supplier within and outside markets.

Mary believes she is hardworking, friendly and forward looking.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Increasing of stock incliding rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn B. is from the village of Mantic Tangub. She is 36 years old. Rosalyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalyn raises and sells pigs. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP that she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This willl be Rosalyn's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition and support their daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of goods in the local community.Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years. In 2008, Mary Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 20,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional capital of her existing business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mary Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.
 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital of her retail store

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 20 años y es madre de 01 hija pequeña niña, que aun depende de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas y a su corta edad, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito.Lleva 02 años dedicándose al negocio y hoy en día  cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta de comidas, donde ella los atiende con la amabilidad y carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado.Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 20 years old, single, and the mother of a young daughter who is financially dependent on her.

Secure in her knowledge of preparing different foods, Jackeline used her first loan of 300 soles to start a business selling prepared meals at the central market in her district. She has been in business for two years and now has a loyal clientele who visit her food stall on a daily basis. She welcomes her customers with her kind and charming personality.

With this loan of 1700 soles, Jackeline will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, and utensils. These items will keep her business running and enable her to provide better service to her customers. She is prepared for anything and still feels strongly about working in order to succeed. Jackeline thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing food

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito, 44, is living in Norala, South Cotabato and has a rice farming business. Being single, he devotes his time to working in his 2-hectare rice field. He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. that offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him, and he later joined in June 2008.

His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php. This amount will be helpful to sustain his business with a low interest charge.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde A. is married with six children and is 53 years old. Her children are excelling in school. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

Kehinde sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She hopes to make more profits during this season which is the high season for sales. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en: Tetyana is divorced with three children. She sells baby carriages and other children's articles. Tetyana started this business 8 years ago. At that time she was able to purchase just a few items for sale. Today she's got two business locations - one at the market and the other at a department store - where she offers her clients a large variety of baby carriages and other children's products. Tetyana would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase more for her inventory. Having three children she knows well what children need and offers such products to her clients. Tetyana's goal is to develop her business further and help her children to get a college education.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories

loans.name: Millicent Adhiambo

texts.en: Millicent Adhiambo A. used to sell clothing door-to-door, but she ventured into retail shop and maize business and she has never looked back. She is a 34-year-old mother of 4 children and she considers herself to be an iron lady of business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to expand her business. Her dream is to ensure a future for her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of maize

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
Rosejean B., 33, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Zacarias B., a Jeepney driver, she is blessed with one child who is in grade school. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Aside from managing their tricycle business, she also sells prepaid mobile phone credits.

Rosejean has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) since last April. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows for the maintenance and improvement of her tricycle business. Her business lets her earn a profit of 16,500 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, buying tricycle parts and for the renewal of license and permit.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can save for her child’s schooling and fix their house.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying tricycle parts and renewal of license and permit

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun T., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokny Mot (pictured together), 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and just have one young son who is attending grade two. 

Bunthoeun has been a construction worker for five years in his village. Mrs. Sokny Mot has been a silk weaver for 10 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The house where they live has fallen down in some areas and it's difficult for them to live. Hence, Bunthoeun is requesting his first loan of $800 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia I. is from the village of Sta. Catalina. She is 33 years old. Sonia is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sonia I..

Sonia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sonia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sonia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José Andrés Seque ira O.,  Labora como Estadígrafo B en la Unidad de compra y Suministro en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos crédito con CEPRODEL durante dos  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y pintura para la remodelación de  su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

José dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José Andrés S. O. works as a statistician for the purchasing department of the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. He is married and has three dependent children attending school. José has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has received two loans. During this time, he invested the proceeds in home improvements.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and paint so that he can remodel his house. All of his loans have been aimed at providing better and more secure living conditions for his children. José says the loans that been provided have brought about an improvement to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel his house

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Mrs. Saturnina L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children.

Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery inventory for her retail store.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 33 años, casada y tiene seis hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva ayacuchana. Faustina pasa por una crisis económica, pero asegura que existe un futuro promisorio, tiene secundaria incompleta, por lo que no pudo concretarlo por cosas del destino, dejando sus estudios para integrarse a la actividad agrícola en donde cultiva cacao y plantas frutales. Pese a los obstáculos, no la desanima en su objetivo de sobresalir. A través del sembrío tradicional, ella está preservando parte de la agricultura de sus antepasados y del medio ambiente. En tiempo de sembrío y cosecha, contrata a peones para que le ayuden en esta labor, pero hay oportunidades en que recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, al final sus productos son vendidos al por mayor y menor, en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, logrando mejorar paulatinamente su economía. Generalmente su tiempo de trabajo es, de lunes a sábado desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM. En el futuro piensa tener una fuente de soda y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que en sus comunidades hay escasos tiendas de fuente de soda. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la eficiencia y el buen trato entre compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará terrenos, para así producir a gran escala y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Faustina, 33, is married and has 6 school-age children. They all live together in their own house in the Ayacucho jungle. Faustina is undergoing an economic crisis but assures us that the future is promising. She did not complete secondary school for destiny prevented her from doing so; she left her schooling in order to incorporate herself into farming where she grows cocoa and fruit trees. Despite obstacles, she is not discouraged of reaching her goals. Through traditional farming methods she is preserving farming techniques of her ancestors and helping to protect the environment. During planting and harvest seasons she hires farmhands to help her with these chores and sometimes her relatives help her out too. She sells her products both at wholesale and retail in her community’s food gathering centers thereby gradually improving her economic conditions. Her usual work routine is 7am to 6pm, Monday-Saturday. In the future she would like to have a soda fountain in order to improve her income because there are just a few soda fountains in her community. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also expresses her gratitude to her communal group for their efficiency and the nice way they all treat each other. She will use the requested funds to buy farm land to produce good quality products on a larger scale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Jamilyn

texts.en: Jamilyn C.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is a 22-year-old single woman from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Jamilyn has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Jamilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jamilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jamilyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 48 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora y caritativa, está casada con Jorge de 64 años, juntos tienen 8 hijos pero sólo vive con 6 de ellos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la carpintería, empezando desde muy temprano, en donde su esposo realiza los diseños, cortando la madera y dar forma a los muebles, mientras Teodora se dedica a dar el acabado necesario, lijando puertas, ventanas, ropero, armario, escritorio, cama, entre otros. Lo que más le agrada es trabajar en compañía de su esposo, pues afirma que esta convivencia como compañeros de trabajo y pareja los ha unido más, compartiendo logros y derrotas. Esta oficio le es muy rentable porque con las ganancias pudieron pagar la educación de sus hijos, comprar terrenos, construir su casa, además adquirieron un moto carro que alquilan y les facilita otros ingresos adicionales. Es por ello que se siente muy entusiasmada, en ampliar su carpintería, además espera terminar de construir más habitaciones en su vivienda. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, en donde es presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará madera para continuar fabricando muebles.
texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old. She is a very enterprising and charitable woman. She is married to Jorge, who is 64. Together they have 8 children but she only lives with 6 of them in her own home. She works in carpentry. She starts very early. Her husband makes the designs, cutting the wood and giving form to the furniture, while Teodora does the necessary finishings: sanding doors, windows, dressers, desks, beds, among others. What she likes the most is working in her husband's company. She affirms that being co-workers has united the couple more, sharing accomplishments and failures. This profession is very profitable because with the earnings they were able to pay for their children's education, buy land, build their house, and buy a motorcycle cab that they rent and which brings in extra income. This is why she is very enthusiastic about growing the carpentry shop; she also hopes to finish building more rooms in her residence. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic about continuing to work in her community group, where she is president of the board of directors. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy wood to continue making furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru: Махмадиева Бибигул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж вместе с детьми работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Они занимаются растениеводством. Сама Бибигул имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота. Она хочет увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Bibigul M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 51 years old; she married and has 5 children. Her husband and children work at a farm, they raise crops. Bibgul has a secondary education. For over 5 years she has been working in animal husbandry, breeding livestock at home. She is requesting the loan to purchase cattle, she would like to increase the number of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es empleado. Trabaja en la Iglesia del cementerio general de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposa vende víveres a crédito. Es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la  zona urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción con lo que podrá refaccionar su vivienda.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Oscar works for the Church of the General Cemetery in La Paz. His wife works selling food on accounts. This is his main source of income with which he supports his family. His home is located in the urban area of Mercurio in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for remodeling his home. This is his first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for remodeling his home

loans.name: Bidoutime

texts.en:
Madame Bidoutime K. is 35 years old and is single with one child. She sells potable water and juice in Lome, Togo.

Madame K. has been selling Pure Water, potable water sold in bags, and juice since 2008. She would like to expand her business and increase her clientele, so she is taking a loan of 120,000 CFA from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise to sell. Hopefully this loan will help increase her profits to better provide for her child.

loans.use: To purchase more water and juice to sell

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia A. is from the village of Madalag. She is 65 years old. Lilia is the group leader of a 2 member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilia is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,450 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma K. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and fishing businesses. She lives in, Brgy. Patao, Bantayan, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog raising and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5200 from her business activities.

 Elma is now borrowing PHP 29,000 so that she  can  purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs that she is raising. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.
