Elma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Gulinar

texts.en:
Gulinar is a brave woman who works hard to support her four children, who help her work in the fields while they learn valuable lessons about life and running a household. Gulinar is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, which she urgently needs to produce a crop that will sell well in the local market. She also plans to use some of the money to buy young cows so that she can produce milk to sell to people who live in her area.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Dilmer

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura y ganadería, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero. El cuenta con cuatro vacas de las cuales diariamente extrae la leche que producen para ofrecerla en venta a un acopiador de la zona. El alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y pastos naturales de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personas y apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de una vaca, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y pueda percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como ganadero y poder adquirir ganado de raza que produzca mas leche.
texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents in the Ciudad de Dios district in San Jose. It is a rural region that is primarily agricultural and farm land, belonging to the Lambayeque province, about 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was four years old he has been raising milking cows. Currently he has four milking cows and they are milked every day. The milk they produce is sold to a distributor in the region. He feeds his animals with a well-balanced diet and with natural grasses to ensure he will always have a good yield. The profits he earns from his business are used to cover his personal expenses and to contribute to the family's finances. Jose wishes to expand his business with the purchase of one more cow. He will be able to increase his production and see an improvement in his earnings. To reach his goal he requires a first time loan from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. This young man is very responsible and devoted to his work. His greatest dream is to keep improving as a dairy farmer and to one day have a herd of purebred cattle, to produce more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Suiorkan's Group

texts.en:
Suiorkan A., 57, is the group’s leader. She is married and has a son who is 24 years old and earns a living by working in construction. In 2009, the family began to supplement its income by breeding livestock. Suiorkan also raises money by reselling apples. From the money the family has earned, it has managed to have a wedding for its son and equip its kitchen. She is applying for this loan to buy an oven. In the future, she hopes to expand the family business and increase its cattle stock. 

Shailoo A., 53, is divorced. She wants to go into business raising livestock and has applied for this loan to buy five animals to raise and resell.   

Kulumkan M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 58, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Her husband works in construction. Thirteen years ago, the family began raising livestock and is applying for this loan to buy two cows to breed. In the future, Kulumkan hopes to be able to send her two children to college.

Atyrkul O., 53, is married and has two children. Her husband makes a living as a herder. Her daughter works as a seamstress, while her son is still in school.  Atyrkul makes a living selling fruit and has applied for this loan to buy apples and pears to sell to her customers. Her goal is to have enough money to send her son to college.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to expand four small businesses

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.en:
Léonie is a leader of the community bank named “Développement Plus” which is composed of 20 micro-entrepreneurs, united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Léonie sells plantain bananas at a market located in the western area of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 1989. Her beginning capital was US$ 50. Currently, through her sales, Léonie makes about US$ 35 per week. Her plans are to use the next loan to purchase some stalks of plantain bananas to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having eight times received and properly repaid loans. She dreams of one day opening a supermarket in her area. Léonie is 46 years old, married and a mother of four children whose ages are between 8 and 14. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some stalks of plantain bananas to resell at a profit

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: S. Fred is Kayunga based and he has been in a boda boda or a commercial motorcycle business for the past 3 years in Kangulumula-Kayunga. With earnings from this business he has supported his family fairly well in terms of better welfare. He also has a beauty salon business. At 38 years old, Fred is single but with 5 kids. With this loan money of 2,500,000 UGX he says he is going to buy another boda boda or motorcycle to expand on his operations.

loans.use: The purchase of another  motorcycle as a means of expanding his business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario N. is from the village of Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Rosario is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling Filipino snack delicacies like suman (rice cake) and maruya (banana fritters) in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosario from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Puntabon, Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sialo Ene

texts.en:
Sialo Ene has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last three years.  She is 32 years old, married to M. Lasiti, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats and 10 sheep which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Sialo wants to open a green grocer shop in town to diversify her income.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats and 10 sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Suos

texts.en: Mrs. Suos Y. is a local farmer from Kompong Chhang Province.  She is married to Nhem Sokhom and has six children who are all single.  She is looking for a loan of US$ 500 to be used on a small transport truck and to decorate her house. She wants to become a groceries seller and wants her children to finish bachelor degrees.

loans.use: To be used on a small transport truck and decorate her house

loans.name: Helga Mary

texts.es: La Señora Helga casada tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir,  su esposo  la ayuda en la confección y entrega de las prendas terminadas, vive en alquiler no cuenta con una vivienda propia, la actividad que desarrolla le sirve para la manutención de ella y su familia, el trabajo que realiza es solo de costura pues no cuenta con capital propio para la materia prima la casa en la que vive es una construcción antigua y cuenta sólo con tres cuartos y  el patio es de tierra, su deseo es poder ahorrar para comprarse una casita y poder vivir cómodamente, con el dinero del crédito comprar telas para confeccionar prendas de vestir para un pedido que le hicieron, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Helga is married and has two children.  Her business is making clothes.  Her husband helps her in making the clothes and in delivering them.  She rents the house where she lives as she doesn't own her own home.  Her business helps her to support herself and her family.  The only work she does is sewing since she doesn't have her own capital for buying raw materials.

The house in which Helga lives is very old and only has three rooms and a dirt patio.  Her wish is to be able to save to buy herself a small house where she can live comfortably.

Helga will use her loan money to buy fabric so that she can make clothes for an order she has.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Como un legado familiar se podría describir la legumbrería de Efraín O. H. quien trabaja en compañía de sus padres para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Desde pequeño, Efraín vio como su padre trabajaba en este negocio, lo que le permitió convertirse en el dueño de su propio negocio, pues a pesar de las pocas ventas en algunas épocas del año y la falta de capital para proveer a sus clientes de más productos, Efraín considera que hay que rebuscársela para sobrevivir. 

Su legumbrería es un negocio pequeño ubicado en Puerto Berrío- Antioquia a orillas del río Magdalena, actualmente Efraín requiere de un crédito para comprar surtido en mayores cantidades y así aumentar su capital de trabajo para responder a las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The family business could be described as a produce market and Efrain O. Hernandez works alongside his parents, earning money to cover the household expenses. Since he was young, Efrain saw how his father managed the business, which taught him to have a small business of his own. During certain times in the year the sales are low and there aren't enough capital funds to provide his clients with more products. Efrain feels like he always needs to be creative in order to survive. 

His produce market is a small business located in Puerto Berrio-Antioquia, along the shores of the river Magdalena. Efrain requests a loan to purchase larger quantities of a variety of products to supplement his inventory and to meet his clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, rent bills and electricity.

Emanuel has been operating a charcoal selling business for the past year, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby.  In his business, he faces a major challenge in competition from other sellers and the high cost of transportation. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. 

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, Emanuel wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Belinda's Group

texts.en:
Belinda S. is from the village of Mansabay bajo,Lopez Jaena. She is 38 years old. Belinda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Belinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood product such as fish in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Belinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Belinda S.'s group is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Belinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers has four members. Its leader, Eng K., 30, is single and lives with her sister who helps Eng K. with her business. Eng K. owns a general store in front of her house and sells plastic items, charcoal, small tools and cooking ingredients among other items. She has been in this business for years. She usually earns a profit of around $4 per day from this business for use to support her family. She would like to seek a loan to add to her savings to replace her broken motorbike.

The other group members are: 

K., age 50, serves as a local police officer and is taking a loan to repair her old house,
S., 30, is taking a loan to buy more poles for her house. 
N., age 48, is fish seller, and is asking for loan to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: To replace her broken motorbike

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam de 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos  ambos estudian , ella se siente muy agradecida con los hijos que Dios  le ha dado, su esposo trabaja como director de una Radio ambos comparten con los gastos familiares del hogar, ella labora como directora del Colegio Cesar Augusto Salinas  Pinell desde hace 15 años,  Lilliam es una mujer profesional que recientemente se acaba de recibir de master, es una docente  muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajos, alumnos y por su familia por ser bien sociable.                                                                                          

Solicita su 9no credito para mejorar la infraestreuctura de su vivienda dando de esta manera mejores condiciones en su hogar, no omite manifestar el agradecimiento a Kiva con el credito anterior pues logro su proposito de repellar su casa.  

Su mayor sueño en  la vida es estudiar un  doctorado y que sus hijos sigan en buenos caminos de Dios y que estudien para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Lilliam is 37 years old and has two school-aged children and is very thankful for her family.  Her husband works as the director of a radio station and, together, they share the household expenses.  She has worked as the director of the Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell school for 15 years.  Lilliam is a professional woman who just received her masters degree.  She is a well-loved teacher among her colleagues and students as well as her family because she is very sociable.

She is requesting her ninth loan to improve her home's infrastructure and improve living conditions.  She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan which allowed her to plaster the walls.

Her dream is to obtain her doctor's degree and that her children follow in God's footsteps and study to be good people.

loans.use: To improve home infrastructure

loans.name: Norma Leonor

texts.es:
Norma de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora un día que fue a Guayaquil recaudo un dinero y lo invirtió en  una pequeña tienda.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente y sola en algunas ocasiones cuando se enferma la viene ayudar su hermana. Con el préstamo va a comprar producto para su tienda como arroz, aceite, azúcar para así incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea terminar de adecuar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old, and is a hardworking woman. One day she went to Guayaquil and collected some money and invested it in a small grocery store.

At present, she works each day alone and when she gets sick her sister comes to help.

With the loan, Norma will buy merchandize for her store like rice, oil, and sugar to increase her earnings. In the future she hopes to finish reworking her home.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 47 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Flora joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is a widow taking care of  ten dependents.  She is into multiple businesses, such as selling fish, clothes and making gari for sale. Gari is made from cassava. (In this picture, she is peeling the cassava to make the gari). She has been in this business for some time now and she wants to increase the quantity of gari she sells. She needs a loan to purchase more quantities of cassava to process into gari for sale. The additional income realized from the loan will be invested back into her business so she can take proper care of her dependents.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to process into gari for sale.

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 26 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería tiene cuadro cuadras de terreno siembra maíz, habas y cebolla tiene siete cabezas de ganado y ovejas. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar vehículo y comprar más terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta ver novelas, pasear, y tejar.
texts.en:
Maria Olga, 26, is married and lives with her ​​husband  and children in  Canton Guaranda, province of Bolivar. She has 3 children.

The communal bank GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA (CHINIPAMBA COAL WOMEN'S GROUP) is based in the Chinipamba coal community, in Canton Guaranda, about 20 minutes away from the cooperative's office. Most of the partners work in agriculture, livestock and trade, growing rice, barley, beans, quinoa and potatoes and raising animals such as dairy cows and poultry. 

Maria works in agriculture and livestock. She owns four parcels of land and she grows corn, beans and onion. She also has seven heads of cattle and sheep. She does her shopping in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market of the same city. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies and animal feed. The loan will support her financially so she can meet her needs. She faces challenges such as pests, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to buy a vehicle and buy more land to continue to grow. 

She enjoys reading novels, going for walks and knitting.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 35 years old, she has four children who are 1½ to 11 years old. All her children are in school. Her husband is a driver. 

Angelique has been selling sorghum for the past five years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum, and with the profits from increased sales she plans to buy a cow. In the future she plans to build the family a house.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.  Nenita has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del  BA. Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Estudió hasta 4to de secundaria.
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos ciclos, su primer préstamo solicitado de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de carne vacuno y porcino.
Eugenia solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de seis degollados de corderos para venderlos en el mercado de Ilave.  En  el negocio le ayuda su esposo e hijos, también cuenta que su esposo trabaja en transporte de servicio urbano (es chofer).  
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y una cortadora de carne.
Lo que le gusta de su BA. Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the "San Miguel Arcángel II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She studied up to the fourth year of high school.

Eugenia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling beef and pork.

Eugenia is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in buying six [dead] lambs to sell in Ilave market.  Eugenia's husband and children help her in her business.  She tells us that her husband works as a driver, providing an urban transport service.

Eugenia's dream is to own a grocery store and a meat cutter.  What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy six [dead] lambs

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Melisiana, who is in her mid-forties, is married with three children who go to school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for six years now. She works from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Melisiana’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees and increase the amount of produce she sells. She paid back all of her loans successfully.

Melisiana hopes for a loan for household expenses and to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She will share this 4,510,000 TZS loan with her loan group, "Utamaduni," which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Melisiana’s dream is to one day finish building her house which she has already started.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell and for household expenses.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).   

Lukiya has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. Lukiya sells her products door-to-door, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Lukiya has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Lukiya gets additional income through bricklaying work.    

The main business challenges for Lukiya include the ever increasing prices of clothes and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a permanent place for her business and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. 

Lukiya lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication,   school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mujeres De Patachaj Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Ramona es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 1 D. los cuales estudia el nivel básico D. educación, se dedica a la confección D. tejidos: pantalones, blusas, faldas, etc. Inició este negocio  con deseos D. superación y prestando un poco D. capital, y hasta el momentos lleva 12 años D. experiencia, en el futuro espera agrandar su negocio y tener variedad D. ropa para la venta. DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar telas D. diferentes clases y colores. Las demás integrantes D. grupo se dedican a las actividades D.: Confección D. pantalones, faldas, blusas, tejido D. sabanas, y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en: María Ramona is married and is 52 years old.  She never went to school.  She has six children one of which is in elementary school.  She is a weaver.  She makes pants, blouses, skirts, etc.  She started the business wanting to improve herself and borrowing a bit of capital.  To date, she has 12 years’ experience and hopes to enlarge the business in the future and to have a wiD. variety of clothes on sale.  She decided to organize a group to request a loan that will serve to buy fabric of different types and colors.  The other group members carry out various activities, such as: making pants, skirts, and blouses, weaving sheets and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is single with two children. Caroline is 48 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena.

To earn a living, Caroline has a general store business. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,500. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase a variety of grocery items. Caroline has been a member of PMPC for one year.

In the future, Caroline hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items.

loans.name: Tubulwanyise Naluvule Group

texts.en:
A retail enterprise is what this 54-year-old father of nine has been banking on for the last 15 years to earn his keep. Badru principally sells a variety of general merchandise, for example, sugar, salt, maize flour, plastics, paraffin, beans, ballpoint pens, exercise books, etc. He plies his trade in the metropolis of Kampala.

A checkered experience is what he expected at the inception of his business. The last 15 years have been marked by fluctuations in his fortunes. The bad times have not caught him off balance and in the good times, he has kept his feet on the ground. Remaining philosophical in the face of hard times has been a stock in trade he has reckoned on to weather the storms in his business transactions.

His retail shop has been doing good business owing to the good reputation he has and the fact that he meets the demand of his customers. Weekly his business's sales profits are to the tune of Uganda shillings 75,000. Badru also subsists on side income from his small farming business.

He says this Kiva loan will be used for the purchase of more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, a 58-year-old married mother of one, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines for 10 years. Now requesting a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more gallons of coconut wine to sell, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cristina, tiene 40 años de edad; es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, 3 años de edad, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende granos en las gradas del mercado, ella también lava ropa  en diferentes domicilios y en algunos hoteles, la socia siempre esta tras de un trabajo para poder mantener a sus hijos y en esta ocasión la socia desea comprar granos al por mayor para implementar su negocio y esto le ayudara a que le compren granos para semillas de sembríos, la socia desea a futuro tener un espacio estable, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos al por mayor.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the "Señor de Wimpillay Choco" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Cristina is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children aged 9, 7 and 3.  Her business is making retail sales.  Cristina sells grains on the steps of the market.  She also washes clothes in private homes and some hotels.  She always working so that she can support her children.

On this occasion, Cristina would like to buy grain wholesale to stock her business.  This will help her sell grain for seeds which will be sown.  In the future, she would like to have a stable sales location.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying grains wholesale.

Cristina is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying grains wholesale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.Tessie has been pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 45 years old and is married. He has three children (one son and two daughters) and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi M. City.

He and his wife earn an income by running a general store at their house. Chau intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery from his store.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia lives in the village of Urbnisi, Kareli district. She is 42 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband – Zurab, her  19-year-old son, and her parents (retired). Natia works as a teacher in a local school. Her husband is the head of  the farming business of the family. 

Alongside her main job, Natia is busy with a trade business. She has a small grocery store in the village. She rented space and opened this store two years ago. She brings grocery products from Tbilisi (the capital of the country) and sells them in the store. The customers of the store are mainly the village population. 

Zurab is heading up the farming activities of the family. The family owns 3 hectares of land, where maize, beets and onions are grown. Harvested crops are sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris (approximately 600 USD), including Natia’s parents’ pensions.

Natia requested credit for purchasing grocery products for the store. She will increase her stock in trade and offer a wider assortment of products to her customers. It will increase the sales and thus the income of the family. Natia will use the ncreased income for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to increase stock in trade in grocery store.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are in school.  He describes himself as a hardworking businessman.  He owns a van, which he uses as a transport business.  He also runs a retail shop and farms to increase his income.  He has employed one person to assist him in the business. 

In the next five years he wants to expand his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.  Phillip is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his van.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosemarie has a shop from which she sells canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to support children's education to college level.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Sonia has a shop where she sells sleepers, canned goods and detergents. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more stock to sell.
Sonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, canned goods and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 33 year old gentleman who is married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past ten years.

He has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd. to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers and to buy more farm animals. He has been a good client who hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer and to buy more farm animals.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 30 years old. She is married to Peter and they are blessed with one child who is six years old.  Emma has been running a spare part business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 6,500, which she uses to support her family.

Emma is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy spare parts to add to her business. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to add to her business.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy has been working in the construction industry as far back as her first job. Since 2010, she has owned an electric company, which provides electrical, telecommunications and other wiring contractor services. She decided she wanted to do electrical contracting because she enjoys being part of building and construction projects, and she knew it would be fulfilling and challenging. Some of Kathy’s family members are also involved in the business, helping with office duties. She says the biggest challenge for the business is the current state of the economy, since construction and building jobs are not as plentiful as they used to be. Kathy feels fortunate to have had a good financial year considering the economy.

This loan will be used to purchase electrical equipment used on jobsites and will be used with the start of Kathy’s next major contract.

loans.use: To purchase electrical equipment for job sites.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. She is married and makes bags and mats in the Philippines. Estelita has been in this business for five years now.

Estelita has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Nicole Estrella

texts.es:
Nicole es una joven de 20 años de edad, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, así como también por sus actividades principales como la agricultura en especial el cultivo de Algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Nicoles es una joven muy trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de enfermería, pero debido a que no pudo conseguir trabajo, tuvo l idea de tener su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, en el cual trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y pued atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo ya que es muy amable y sobre todo tiene una muy buena sazón para la preparación de sus platillos.

Nicole está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores, mesas, sillas, entre otros para poder brindar una mayor comodidad a sus cliente sy poder exhibir sus productos de manera mas higiénica, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en: Nicole is a young woman of 20 who lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm climate. Its main industry is agriculture, in particular farming cotton, grapes, asparagus and other crops. Nicole is very hardworking, and with a lot of effort she was able to study for a nursing degree, but because she was not able to find work, she started a small business selling food. She works about 10 hours a day and serves around 20 customers. She thinks the business is going well because she is very friendly and above all her meals are very tasty. Nicole is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help she will be able to purchase counters, tables, chairs and other items in order to provide more comfort to her customers and display her products more hygienically. In this way, she will increase her profits and be able to keep fighting to realize her biggest dream: "To have a big restaurant and make her parents proud."

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and other items.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Odbayar is 39 years old married man who lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. He has three children elder daughter attends institute and other two attend high school. The family lives in a house and their house became so old and unsafe.

Thus he needs to make housing project, so he is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT loan to purchase housing materials to renovate his current house. He said: "Don't be scared if u can do it", it shows that he is very brave and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase necessary housing materials

loans.name: Dodarjon

texts.ru:
Додаржон  молодой человек, и ему 31 лет. Он женат и счастливый отец одного 1 летного ребенка. Додаржон  учился только в школе. У него не было возможности для поступления в университет. Додаржон решил заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в районе, после окончании школы. Его научил его отец. Сейчас он идет по стопам отца. Уже 10 лет он занимается выращиванием баранов. 
Додаржон в настоящее время имеет баранов. Его бизнес идет хорошо. Он разводит баранов и продает их на скотном рынке. Он сам один трудится и старается, прокормить жену и ребенка. Его жена дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. В настоящее время Додаржон  хотел бы приобрести пару барана и увеличить их численность, но у него не имеется определенная сумма денег. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом  для приобретения необходимые средства. Додаржон заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Dodarjon is a young man, he is 31 years old. He is married and the happy father of a one-year-old child. Dodarjon just has a school education. He was not able to go to university. After graduating from school, Dodarjon decided to work in agriculture in his area. His father taught him. Now he is following in his father's footsteps. He has been rearing sheep for ten years. Dodarjon has some sheep at the moment, and his business is going well. He breeds sheep and sells them at the livestock market. He works alone and tries to feed his wife and child. His wife sews women's clothes at home. At present Dodarjon would like to acquire a couple of sheep to increase his flock, but he does not have the necessary sum of money so he has applied for a loan to acquire the funds. Dodarjon expresses his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to increase his flock.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en: Jade signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Jade is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena divorced her husband one year ago, and she and her children were left completely desperate and he never helped with the expenses. Facing this difficult and worrisome situation she started making and selling desserts and candy, with her only goal to cover the basic necessities for her children and continue supporting their studies. Struggling alone for her family has not been an easy mission, but her great integrity has carried her through.

She needs your help, and she needs a loan of $250 to purchase ingredients to meet a strong demand she is currently seeing. Help Lorena provide a better quality of life and an education for her children. Think how difficult it has been for her to face adversity. Please help her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena hace un año se divorció de su esposo, y ella y sus 3 hijos quedaron totalmente desamparados, pues él nunca les ayuda con los gastos. Ante esta difícil y preocupante situación ella comenzó a elaborar y vender repostería y dulces, esto con el único objetivo cubrir la necesidades básicas de su hijos y seguir apoyándoles con su estudios. Luchar sola por su familia no ha sido una misión fácil, pero su gran entereza la ha acompañado.

Ella necesita de tu apoyo, pues requiere de un préstamo de $250 dólares, para poder comprar insumos y hacer frente aun fuerte pedido que actualmente tiene, ayuda a Lorena ha brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos. Piensa en lo difícil que ha sido vender las adversidades para ella y por favor apóyala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.en:
Nurullo started his business over 5 years ago. He is renting a place in open-air market of Chkalovsk. He is married and has three children. The turnover of his business is fast. He started receiving loans three years ago and step-by-step has increased the loan amount from $100 to $1000.

As trading is his only source of income, Nurullo would like to open his own shop, by his house, because working at an open-air market is very difficult, especially in winter time. He plans to use the profit for the reconstruction of his house. After that, he can stay there with his family and one of the rooms he can equip for the shop.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Mrs. Then N. is 18 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  She operates a small grocery store in her village and can make about $10 per day.  N.'s husband buys grocery products in bulk, then transports them to the market to sell to grocers.  This business activity generates about $7 per day in revenue.  The couple hopes to use this loan to purchase two cows, which they will raise and eventually sell to a butcher.  Additionally, they hope to purchase more grocery products so that N. can expand her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase two cows, and also to purchase grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale is married with 6 children and lives in the village of Malie. Her husband works their taro plantation and she helps with selling the taro. She sells 2-3 bags of taro once a week at Fugalei market, from which she earns $200-$250.

Fale said that “Before joining the program, [her] family depended only on remittances from overseas.” This changed when she joined South Pacific Business Development in 2004. She was able to access loans so she could pay for her children's school fees and a lot of other family expenses. She is requesting an $800 loan to buy fertilizer and weedkiller for the taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and weedkiller for the plantation

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Suarni

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Suarni owns a pig breeding business of the local Bali breed. Currently, she has 2 breeder sows. Her daily routine of feeding them were tedious but the rewards will be big and promising. Within about 5 months, her pigs produced about 8 to 12 piglets. And within a month can be sold for between Rp 100.000 – Rp 150.000 (about USD10 to 15) each. With the loan of Rp 1.400.000 (USD150), over 4 months Ni Nyoman Suarni generated profit of Rp 800.000 (USD90), monthly profit of Rp 200.000 to cover living expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Suarni mempunyai usaha ternak babi penginduk babi jenis lokal atau babi Bali. Saat ini Nyoman Suarni memelihara 2 ekor induk babi lokal . Setiap hari ritinitas yang dilakukan memberi makan babinya sekilas memang rutinitas yang sangat membosankan tapi mendatangkan pendapatan yang besar dan menjanjikan. Empat sampai lima bulan babinya sudah bisa beranak sekitar 8-12 ekor. Dalam waktu satu bulan kemudian babi sudah dapat dijual dengan harga berkisar Rp. 100.000,- s/d Rp. 150.000,-./ekor Dengan modal 1.400.000,- selama 4 bulan Ni Nyoman Suarni bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 800.000,- . Setiap bulan bisa mendapat penghasilan Rp.200.000,- untuk biaya hidup keluarga mereka.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow - female pig (Membeli Induk babi)

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Business Description

Fernanda does computer work, and also provides a copy service. She also cuts both mens' and womens' hair. She has 6 years of experience in this field, having learned from a family member who trained her while she saved money to begin her own business. Her work day is from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.

Loan Use

Fernanda is asking for a loan to purchase more stationary material, including pictures, notebooks, pencils, and other childrens' school supplies. Because of the growth of her client base, Fernanda has seen the need to offer additional merchandise, so that she can continue to serve her client's needs.

Personal Information

Fernanda has two children and is 29 years old. One of her children attends school, an opportunity made possible by Fernanda's hard work. She and her husband have a friendly cement home. Fernanda's desire is to grow her business and increase her capital, for the benefit of her children and her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Fernanda se dedica a realizar trabajos en computadora como también copias a documentos, además de cortes de cabello tanto para hombre como para mujeres. Teniendo como experiencia 6 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, ya que esta actividad lo aprendió de un familiar quien le inculco esta labor, en la que con capital propio saco adelante su propio negocio. Trabajando desde las 8am, hasta las 19pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Fernanda solicita el crédito para comprar más materiales de papelería como: láminas estudiantiles, cuadernos, lápices y otros artículos para la educación de los niños. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Fernanda se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su mercadería, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes muy bien atendidos.

Información Personal

Fernanda tiene 29 años de edad, en donde solo vive con sus 2 hijos, que actualmente los tiene a uno estudiando, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza en su actividad a podido darle esa oportunidad de estudio, además su domicilio es de estructura de cemento muy acogedora, donde también vive con su conyugue. Los anhelos de Fernanda es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos, en si de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase of stationary materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru:
Orifa R., 51, is married and has 9 children. Orifa buys, feeds and sells cattle. Cattle farming has been Orifa’s business and main source of income for 5 years. Orifa plans to use this loan to purchase a few young animals, raise and then sell them. Orifa’s son assist Orifa in the business. Orifa plans to repay this loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Орифа – 51 год, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 9-х детей. Орифа занимается откормкой и продажей скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение уже 5 лет, и это является основным источником её дохода. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько голов крупного рогатого скота для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней она продаёт скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретает молодняк. Прибыль использует для содерждание семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает её сын. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Yabteclum 9 Group

texts.es:
Maria is 38 years old and for the past 5 years, she has been taking a wheelbarrow full of fruits and vegetables to sell them on the streets of her community every morning. She has 10 children, so all her income goes to buying more products to sell and to pay for household expenses.

With this loan, Maria wishes to improve her little itinerant business and gain more income to support her family. The other members of the group are Marcela Pérez, a craftswoman, and Veronica Pérez, a business woman who sells children and women's clothes.

Translated from Spanish to English by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA CUENTA CON 38 AÑOS, DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS TODAS LAS MAÑANAS ACOMPAÑADA DE UNA CARRETILLA SALE A VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS POR LAS CALLES DE SU COMUNIDAD, TIENE 10 HIJOS POR LO CUAL SU GANANCIA LA DISTRIBUYE ENTRE LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y EL INGRESO FAMILIAR, CON EL CREDITO DESEA INCREMENTAR SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO AMBULANTE Y OPTENER MAS GANANCIAS PARA AUMENTAR SU INGRESO FAMILIAR, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO MARCELA PÉREZ ES ARTESANA Y VERONICA PÉREZ ES COMERCIANTE DE ROPA PARA NIÑOS Y DAMAS.

loans.use: Purchase of more products

loans.name: Nanfiou

texts.fr:
Born on 11 May 1979 in Sakete in the Benin plateau, Mr. Nanfiou A. is married and has one child. A tailor by profession, several years ago he began selling traditional ready-to-wear clothes, which he sends to other countries in the region, notably Mali and Burkina Faso, where the quality of his work is highly appreciated. The demand inside as well as outside the country is becoming increasingly large, but the means to obtain a supply of fabric and printed cloth for production is insufficient. For this reason, he is asking for a third loan to finance and strengthen his business so as to satisfy the demands of his current clientele and future customers who would like to seek his services.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 11 mai 1979 à SAKETE dans le plateau du BENIN, monsieur A. Nanfiou est marié et père d’un enfant. Brodeur de profession, il s’est lancé depuis quelques années dans la vente des tenues traditionnelles prêt-à-porter qu’il envoie dans les pays de la sous région notamment au Mali et au Burkina Faso où la qualité de son travail est bien appréciée. La demande à l’intérieur comme à l’extérieur du pays devient de plus en plus grandissante mais les moyens de s’approvisionner en tissus et pagne suffisants pour la confession ne répondent pas. Pour cette raison, il sollicite son troisième prêt pour financer et renforcer son activité afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de ses futurs clients qui aimeraient solliciter ses services.

loans.use: To buy 25 bolts of fabric

loans.name: Sayaad Mohammad

texts.en: Sayaad Mohammad lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of one son. He has a small carpet weaving business. He has 6 students who are very hard workers. He exports Afghani carpets to different countries. He wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to buy one or two new machines to continue his business with more success. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy one or two new machines

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
Mrs Ricardina dedicates the majority of her time to her cultivated land now that that is her principle source of sustenance for her family. Agriculturist have always needed to be very careful with sowing the land, which is the first step taken to achieve their goals of production and the augmentation of their income. One way in doing this is to meticulously disinfect the seeds. One large limitation for her is not having the capacity to buy seeds whole sale since their price is high, and this is why she is soliciting a loan

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer>

Doña Ricardina, dedica el mayor tiempo a sus terrenos de cultivo ya que esta es la principal fuente de sustento de su amada familia.Siempre los agricultores tienen que ser muy cuidadosos en la siembra pues es el primer paso para lograr sus metas de producción y el aumento de sus ingresos, es por ello que tienen que desinfectar minuciosamente las semillas.Una gran limitación para ella es no tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de semillas puesto que su precio es significativo, por esa razón solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchas of seeds at whole sale price

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, single and 25 years old, sells footwear for both women and men. She buys her products from Lima, and because of the flexible schedule that her business allows, is able to continue her higher education studies. Rosalina now needs a loan of $350, money which she will invest in the purchase of shoes.

As a member of the Village Bank Prosperity, Rosalina has learned many things about how to educate her children and maintain their house. She dreams of expanding her business, having an established store with a greater variety of shoes, and finishing her professional studies.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank (meaning Black Eyes in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Cristina is a 56-year-old mother of eleven children. Cristina has a restaurant in the district of San Juan Bautista in a rented location near the city. Cristina prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner; her usual customers are city workers. Furthermore, on Sundays Cristina travels to the regional markets where she buys pigs and lambs, which she sells in local markets and to her neighbors.

Cristina needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($900 USD) to invest in more cattle, goats, pigs, cheese and hens.

Cristina´s dream is to improve her business and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Cristina needs a loan to invest in more cattle, goats, pigs, cheese and hens.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Zuhro H. has been in business for a long time. She has been selling food items for the past 10 years. She lives in Dushanbe city with her family. Zuhro is married and has five children. She is 47 years old. Zuhro came to us for a loan in order to increase her variety of goods. This will help her increase the amount of products she sells; this way, she will be able to develop her business further. She must do this because this business is the only source of income for her family. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Холова Зухро бизнесмен со стажем . Уже 10 лет она занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Живет в городе Душанбе со своей семьей. Она замужем и унее пятеро детей. Возраст 47 лет. Обратилась к нам за кредитом , чтобы на полученные деньги увеличить ассортимент товара. Это поможет ей увеличить объем продаваемой продукции и таким образом она сможет развивать свой бизнес дальше. Это сделать ей необходимо , так как ее бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Mrs. Phai Sreymum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which is located in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, consists of fifteen people and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phai S. is the village bank president and she is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes to re-sell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chhing SoP., is a cow breeder who raises two oxen for cultivating rice. Mrs. Phai S. is 24 years old and the mother of two children aged 1 and 3.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion cloches to re-sell in the local market.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es: Amilcar es un joven llevo de sueños y ambiciones como agricultor, gracias a las enseñanzas que tuvo de sus padres, hoy se está iniciando en esta tarea, pero hasta el momento lo está haciendo muy bien, logrado así independizarse, pero sin dejar de apoyar a sus padres y hermanos en los gastos del hogar.  Amilcar desea seguir creciendo y demostrar a todos lo jóvenes de su comunidad que a pesar de ser joven, sí se puede progresar, además de ser ejemplo para sus hermanos, y apoyarlos para que ellos puedan ser mejores cada día, para que puedan estudiar y lograr sus sueños y realizarse con éxito.  Para que pueda seguir apoyando a su familia necesita un préstamo, para comprar abono y fertilizantes necesarios para sus terrenos de cultivo, y seguir invirtiendo en la producción de lechuga, en la cual le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Amilcar is an ambitious young man who dreams of being a farmer. Thanks to what he's learned from his parents, he's well on his way to his dream. He's become independent but he still manages to help his parents, brothers and sisters with family expenses. Amilcar wants to continue growing and to show other young people in his community that, despite being young, it's possible to progress. Furthermore, he wants to set an example for his brothers and sisters and to help them so that they can be better and better by studying and fulfilling their dreams. In order to continue supporting his family, Amilcar needs a loan to buy the fertilizers necessary to cultivate his land and to continue investing in his lettuce crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Sakina M.arshad Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of M. and resides in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrine of the great Punjabi Sufi poet Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years and is the mother of three young children. Sakina bajiu husband is a milk seller by profession and has been selling milk for the past 5 years. He has one buffalo at his house. There are many men in the community that sell milk for a living and competition is great. Sakina baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family.

Sakina baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's milk selling business. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Anwar baji is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for resale. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zakia baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Haleema baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to produce more milk for selling.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
La señora Yolith, socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de el Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Egilba Ramírez Gómez s/n,- cdra 02 caserío san isidro. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas de los caseríos cercanos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite, leche grande y pequeño en caja, detergente de diversas marcas, fideos, papel higiénico y sal en paquetes, también bebidas gasificadas de diferentes marcas sabores y tamaños, etc. Desea surtir bien su negocio para asegurar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre de 07 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo porque todos sus hijos ya son independientes. Tiene como meta ampliar continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolith, member of the Corazon de Jesus (Heart of Jesus) Village Bank lives in the city of Dorado in San Jose de Sisa, San Martin, Peru. She sells groceries from her home located on Egilbe Ramirez Gomen Street in the small hamlet of San Isidro. Her customers are her neighbors and people from the nearby farms. With this $325 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, small and large milk boxes, various brands of detergent, noodles, toilet papers, salt packets, and different sizes and brands of soft drinks. She would like to keep her business well-stocked to assure her of future sales and to satisfy the needs of her customers. She is 61 years old and the mother of 7 children. She currently lives with her husband because all her children are now grown-up and independent. Her goal is to expand her business and keep it well-supplied.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, small and large milk boxes, detergent, noodles, toilet paper, salt packets, and soft drinks

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Imperio (“Empire”) Village Bank. She is a 40-year-old single mother and has two children. She buys grains in regional markets, then brings them to the city of Ayacucho and grinds them into flour to sell. She works alone seven days a week, from 4 a.m. to 3 p.m. 

Teresa is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy more grains (broad beans, corn, wheat, and barley) in the countryside. Her goal for the future is to open her own restaurant to sell soups and mondongo (tripe stew).

loans.use: Buy broad beans, corn, wheat and barley

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah K. is the chairperson of the 4-member group known as the Byona Biyinzika Lending Group in Kyebando, Uganda. She is 57 years old and married with 10 children, who are all grown up, and 6 dependents whom she care for. Sarah has two businesses: a poultry business keeping layers and broilers plus a health drug business selling mostly vitamins, nutritional supplements, and products for HIV/AIDS prevention and care. Her customers come from all over Kyebando, Nansana, and Kampala. She has been operating the business for 6 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past 9 years. With her loan, she plans to buy more health products to distribute in the markets and chicken mash for feeding her chicks.

loans.use: To purchase health products for sale and chicken feed.

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es: El joven Adrián tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Hialeah II etapa en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 6meses, ella venda productos de la Avon para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos,  el sr. Adrián se desempeña como auxiliar de bodega desde hace cuatro años, inicio como ayudante de bodega, y por sus buenas habilidades lo promovieron, pero el espera seguir mejorando para obtener un cargo donde pueda ganar bien para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Este es la octava solicitud de crédito en Afodenic que han sido de beneficios para su familia ya que ha mejorado la infraestructura de su humilde casa, con esta solicitud la quiere para  construir dos paredes de concreto para ir comenzando su casa en las mejores condiciones. Sus planes es tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Adrián is 28 years old and lives in Hialeah II in Managua, the capital. He and his wife have a six-month-old son. His wife sells Avon products to help with their expenses, and Adrián has worked as a warehouse assistant for four years. He began as a helper and was promoted because of his good skills, but he hopes to keep improving to obtain a post where he can earn enough to cover his household expenses. This is his eighth loan with Afodenic, which has benefited his family and improved the infrastructure of his humble home. With this loan, he will construct two concrete walls to continue improving the condition of his house. His plan is to have a worthy home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make two concrete walls

loans.name: Kabwe Group

texts.en:
Agnes has been a clothes seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 7 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $130. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Agnes is 40 years old, married, and has three children: ages 24, 17 and 11. She also cares for three additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Adestelia, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 46-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Ghobeiry in the Beirut suburbs. He has owned a  car welding and body work shop since 1990. Today, Bassam is requesting a $1,000 loan to purchase an air compressor to develop his job.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
P. Gafurjon is 36 years old. He is married with three children. He has five years of experience in the beef business. His wife is a homemaker and Gafurjon is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father works hard every day to support his children with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the population that reside in their region. Gafurjon buys cattle in the market and sells their fresh meat daily to his customers.

Due to high demand, Gafurjon seeks a loan of $USD800 to invest in more cattle so he can have enough meat to meet all his customers' demand.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Mrs. Vun M., 59, and her husband, Mr. Ny Choem, 61, were married in 1978 and have three children: two sons and one daughter, who weaves at home. One of their sons is security guard; another son attends university in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vun has been a silk weaver since she was eighteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a carpenter since 1990, he works in his village. Vun is requesting a loan of US $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Adjélé Mawulé

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle A. a très tôt abandonné les études, devant subvenir  elle-même à ses propres charges, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de mèches, tissages et perruques qu'elle vend en détail, elle souhaite agrandir son activité avec la vente de produits cosmétisques, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier  crédit pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et augmenter son stock avec 4 cartons de mèches, 10 perruques. 
Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a un enfant, c’est avec le revenu issu de son activité qu’elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle A. left school at an early age. As she had to support herself, she began selling hair extensions and hair pieces which she sells retail. She hopes to expand her business and sell cosmetics, so she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics and add to her inventory with 4 cases of hair extensions and 10 wigs.

She is not married but she has a child. The income from her business allows her to support her little family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena es productora D. leche mismo que lo comerciliza a PIL (planta Industrializado D. Leche) el esposo es chofer asalariado es su principal fuente D. ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención D. su familia.

Vive en casa propio ubicado en la comunidad Villandrani (a una hora y media D. la Ciudad D. El Alto).
 
El crédito lo destinara para comprar D. material D. construcción, en este momento solo cuenta con una sola habitación donD. comparten con sus cinco hijos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento D. pago permite aprobarle otro  préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
