Filomena is a dairy farmer, and she sells milk to the industrialized milk plant. Her husband works as a wage-earning driver, which is the main source of income they use to support their family. She lives in her own home which is located in Villandrani (an hour and a half from the city of El Alto). This credit will be used to purchase construction materials. Right now their five children share one room. This is her second credit with Impro. Her good payment record allows her to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila S. is the owner of a small restaurant. She opened her restaurent in Sanepa, Lalitpur, a few years ago. In her restaurant she makes mo:mo (Chinese foods) and serves mo:mo to her customers. In Kathmandu Valley the demand of buff (buffalo) mo:mo is very high. 

Due to the increasing demands of her customers she needs to buy more cooking tools for her restaurant. So Mrs. Lila is requesting Rs 15,000 to buy more mo:mo cooking tools.

Lila has two sons: her older son works in his own grocery store and the younger son works in a motorbike workshop. Her husband, Mr. Basanta S., helps in her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more mo:mo cooking tools

loans.name: Vitalis Nyangoro

texts.en:
Vitalis Nyangoro is married with three children, ages 11, 6 and 1. He runs a charcoal wholesale store jointly with his wife, Pamela. He has been in this business for nine years, during which he has grown from a retailer to wholesaler.

A shortage of capital has been his main problem, and if he'd had the money, he thinks he would have opened more outlets. Lack of tangible security and other regulations prevented him from accessing a bank loan, after which a neighbor who is a KADET client informed him about the products KADET offers. 

He wishes to use the money from this loan to increase his stock of charcoal and consistently increase his ordering quantities, while still serving the retail market, which would increase his sales.  

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
FELICIDAD S. is a 58 year-old widow who lives in Brgy. Canjusa, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.

Felicidad has earned a living selling "Ginamos", a local delicacy made from fermented salted krill, for 30 years of her life. When her husband died, she became depressed from her loss that she thought of giving up her business, but with no adult children to support her, she realized that she had to plan ahead and be financially self-sufficient in her old age. 

With the moral support of her friends and the encouragement from Project Dungganon, Felicidad decided to continue with her Ginamos business, which now provides sufficiently for her by netting an average of PHP 7,000 per month.

For her 12th loan cycle, Felicidad is borrowing PHP 18,000.00 to add to her capital so that she could have more Ginamos to sell. The advantage of Ginamos over other food stuff is that like fine wine, it improves with age. 

What is Ginamos?

Ginamos is a generic Hiligaynon (the local dialect in Western Visayas) term for anything that is salted and aged to ferment - in Tagalog it is known as Bagoong. Ginamos can also refer to fermented salted fish, mussels, oysters, etc. but in general, the term Ginamos refers to mashed salted fermented krill - all the others must be qualified - e.g. Ginamos na isda (fermented salted fish) or Ginamos na Tahong (fermented salted mussels).

Ginamos is prepared by mashing sea salt and krill together until the salt is well mixed into the finely ground krill, then it is kept in containers to age until ready. Ginamos in Negros Island is usually moist but firm and sold by the block or smaller bricks. Vendors usually pre-cut the blocks into different sizes to offer the buyers a selection. People usually buy Ginamos either as a flavor enhancer to dishes like Pinakbet (a vegetable stew) or as a dish by itself. When cooked as a dish, it is usually mixed with vinegar and sauteed with lots of garlic and sometimes with fried pork rind, and is served with rice as a meal or with green mangoes as an appetizer.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL FOR THE BORROWER

loans.name: Olinto Valle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Olinto Valle es originario del centro de Masaya, sus integrantes son Juana Adela C. B., Rosana Gertrudis P. F. y Lilian Francisca S. D., tres microempresarias con alto potencial, dedicación y destreza para el comercio.

La coordinadora del grupo es Juana Adela quien trabaja en la venta de prendas de plata y enchapadas en oro desde hace más de 5 años, tiempo durante el cual se ha desempeñado eficientemente y ha extendido su mercado de una manera eficaz.  Inicio sacando las prendas al crédito con una señora que viajaba a panamá, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que era mejor si solicitaba un crédito para comprar las prendas directamente. Así conoció ADIM y .los resultados han sido grandiosos. Actualmente tiene clientes en los Bancos, la Alcaldía y otras instituciones donde distribuye su mercadería.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la compra de más productos. Está iniciando el segundo ciclo de crédito y espera seguir adelante ya que su mayor sueño es poner una tienda en su casa donde pueda ofertar sus prendas.

Rosana distribuye zapatos y ropa en general, compra los encargos en El mercado Oriental de Managua (Principal centro de comercio, donde se encuentran los productos al por mayor y a mas bajos precios) y los vende en Masaya. Y Lilian quien distribuye cosméticos de la Zermat y de la Avon.
texts.en:
The Olinto Valle Group originates from central Masaya. The members are Juana Adela C. B., Rosana Gertrudis P. F., and Lilian Francisca S. D.. These three micro-entrepreneurs possess great potential, dedication, and business acumen.

Juana Adela is the group coordinator. She has been selling gold and silver jewelry for more than 5 years. During this time, she has worked efficiently and has been able to expand her market with great effect. She started buying jewelry on credit from a woman who traveled to Panama, but she eventually realized that she was better off taking out a loan and buying the jewelry directly. She learned about ADIM, and her results have turned out great. Her existing customers are bank employees, municipal employees, and those who work at other institutions where she distributes her merchandise.

Juana Adela intends to use her loan to buy more products. She is starting her second loan cycle and expects to succeed. Her greatest dream is to open a store in her home where she can sell her jewelry.

Rosana sells shoes and clothing. She picks up her orders from the Managua Eastern Market (the main center of trade, where products are offered wholesale and prices are lower) and then sells her merchandise in Masaya. Lilian is a distributor of cosmetics made by Zermat and Avon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry & other merchandise

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia S. (0) is a 68-year-old woman living in the town of Lufilufi 3. She is married and has ten adult children. Silia owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years. Silia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise. Silia is now requesting a new loan of 1,700 WST which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda A. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 36 years old. Fernanda is married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Fernanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Fernanda is just starting this business.

In 2006, Fernanda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fernanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Fernanda is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Fernanda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. is a 55-year-old woman from Agusan Del Sur who earns income from rice farming. Like other farmers, she acknowledges her need for financial support. Because her farm is still short of farm inputs, she is requesting a loan of Php6,000 from CEVI to purchase additional inputs so that her crops will grow well. This loan will surely help Gloria in her living.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna G. is from the village of Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, married, and has 5 adult-aged child. To make a living, Edna makes and sells food in schools. She has operated this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (or about $100 US) a month from these activities.

In 1999, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 pesos from HSPFI. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 pesos (or about $175) which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She is opting to maintain her loan amount. This loan will be the 2nd Edna has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Catuan, Lunao, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Madrona De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Madrona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 65 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Madrona, se dedica a la venta de menestras y lleva 24 años en este negocio, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Nº 2 - puesto Nº 17, y desde muy joven a Madrona le gustaba trabajar, por lo que poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día, son clientes fijos en su puesto. Nos cuenta que su negocio consiste en la venta de especias como: Maní y maíz crudo, tostado y molido, harina de plátano, para mazamorras, semillas de shicashica (fruto selvático) rico en aceite natural, algunas verduras como: fréjoles secos, cacao con harina de maíz, etc. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará en sacos de cacao, maíz y maní, para luego preparar mantequilla de maní, maíz amarillo, para la preparación de chichas, fréjoles en kilos, racimos de plátanos verdes,  para preparar harina de plátano.

Madrona, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo realizado durante tantos años, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días y es muy conocida en el mercado. Agradace al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella.
texts.en:
Madrona belongs to the Communal Bank "Planting Future" in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department of Peru. She is separated, 65 years old, and mother of four children who are all independent now. Madrona sells dried vegetables and has been in this business for 24 years. Her business is located in Market No. 2 at Stand No. 17. Since she was a young woman Madrona has enjoyed working. Her business consists of selling products such as: raw, roasted, and crushed peanuts, plantain flour, cornstarch, shicashica (a jungle fruit) rich in natural oils, and some vegetables like: dry beans, cacao with corn flour, etc. With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy bags of cacao, corn, and peanuts to later make peanut butter, yellow corn for making chicha (maize liquor), beans by the pound, and bunches of green plantains to prepare plantain flour. Madrona feels very proud of the work she has done over the course of so many years. The good product that she sells has provided her with faithful clientele that buys from her every day and has made her very well known in the market. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for its unconditional support to women like her.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried vegetables by the pound in sacks

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is 22 years old. He’s not married but runs his own business in order to support his parents with the family's expenses. He sells children’s clothes at the local market. Parviz is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor, and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Parviz has been running his business for 5 years. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($700 USD) to increase his inventory. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own one day.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods for sales.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina P. is from the village of Ramos East. Avelina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Avelina earns approximately 2,000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2009, Avelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Avelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Darhijav

texts.en:
Darhijav is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her 23-year-old daughter in the Khovd province of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and her older children are living and working on their own.

Darhijav operates a food café in a local market and a grocery shop near her home. She operates her café during the winter months and her grocery shop during the summer months. She began her business in 2000, and since then, has achieved a great reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. She would like to open a second hand shop in the future in order to reach more customers and grow her income. She says, “All of my children are living on their own except for my youngest daughter. I want her to be an educated young lady with a happy life.”

Darhijav is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of foods for her café.

loans.use: To purchase food for her cafe

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been selling women’s clothes and shoes for a long time and hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Veronica 57 years old and the mother of five children. All her children, with the exception of the youngest child, are graduates. She is very happy to be referred to as “Mama Graduates” in her neighborhood.

Veronica is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more women’s clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Veronica is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson A. O. is 50 years old, and married with seven children. His wife is a farmer and their children are still schooling.

His business is located at Tindiyo in Kakamega. Kakamega is a town in the western part of Kenya where sugarcane cultivation is the major farming activity. It is well known as the sugar belt region.

Hudson’s business is located along a busy highway where for the last four years he has engaged in selling meat to the local people and the local schools as well. He has managed to employ two people and he has hopes to be the best supplier of meat in Tindiyo.

Despite his financial obligations, Hudson has managed to keep his children in school. His dream is to give them quality education and also to own his own business premises.

Hudson’s major challenges are transporting the cows and some of his customers refusing to pay their debts. He will use his loan to buy more cows to supply more meat to the people of Tindiyo. Hudson is very strict and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows for more meat supply.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthorn Choub Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village loan includes 13 people who live in Krasang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chanthorn C. is the village bank president. She was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice. She is not selling the rice. It is just for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chel Cheal, is a construction laborer. They have a problem because the rice field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, Mrs. Chanthorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire some laborers to do farming. She is the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in the garment factory, one is a construction laborer, and one is enrolled in the local public school. All the members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora's Group

texts.en:
Leonora C. is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Leonora is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leonora is single. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Leonora is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leonora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle B. is into making and selling food at the same time as managing a small sari sari store selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. Michelle has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yeama

texts.en: Yeama Y. is a trader who has a provisions shop along the Old Railway Line in Bo. She is married to a surveyor and has two children. Both children are in secondary school. Her husband assists her greatly in terms of sales and even monitors to see that her business does well. She is seeking a loan to buy more items to stock her shop in order to meet her customers' needs. She is very committed to her business and hopes to use the proceeds from the business to start building her house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: This loan is for a group that consists of six people from Char village in Kandal province. The group leader is Mrs. Sophea Y., who was selected for that role by all the group members. Each group member will use her loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophea Y. sells desserts in a local village. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver who earns some money to support their family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sophea Y. is asking for a loan to concrete her house. This couple does not have a child.

loans.use: To concrete her house

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años, comparte su vida con su esposa Marina de 48 años, juntos tiene 5 hijos de los cuales vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Está familia trabaja duro y parejo para vivir cómodamente. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de transporte público, ya que la trayectoria al pueblo de San pedro es muy difícil por lo que las personas escogen camiones para trasladarse, de esa manera Francisco vio una fuente de ingresos, por ello opto utilizar su camioneta como una vehiculo más de transporte. Paralelo a este trabajo, se dedica a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace 20 años. Lo que más le agrada hacer es el de transportar a las personas para que lleguen a su destino, sin embargo corre el riesgo de malograr su camión. Él asegura que sus actividades son bastante rentables porque percibe ingresos económicos diarios y puede vivir sin preocupaciones. En adelante espera comprarse un terreno agrícola más para aumentar la productividad de sus frutos, ya que considera de mucha rentabilidad. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contento de trabajar con su grupo comunal porque incentivan siempre a ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus cultivos de las plagas.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 48, shares his life with his 48 year old wife, Marina. They have five children, and they live with two of them in their own house. This family works hard and together in order to live comfortably. He has worked providing public transportation service for over ten years. The path to the town of San Pedro is very difficult. That is why people choose trucks to go there. That is how Francisco saw a source of income. He chose to use his light truck as another transportation vehicle. Along side of this work he takes care of his coffee crops. He has been doing this for 20 years. What pleases him the most is transporting people so that they arrive at their destination. However, he runs the risk of his light truck breaking down. He assures us that his activities are quite profitable because he receives daily income and is able to live without worries. Later he plans to buy another piece of farming land to increase the productivity of his fruits. They are very profitable. This is his third loan with MFP. He is happy to be working with his communal bank because they are always motivated to save. With the loan he is requesting he will buy various sacks of fertilizers to protect his crops from pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es: Erika Lissette tiene 29 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella ya tiene experiencia con financiamientos, pues ha demostrado que la buena administración es la clave del éxito para su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y el destace de cerdo, pues es una joven que le gusta diversificar su actividad cada día más, por lo que es necesario aprender diferentes negocios para mejorar su condición económica. Por lo que sale a ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante pero con muchas ganas de mejorar.  Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como pintura de labios, perfumes, colonias, tratamientos entre otros. Sueña seguir manteniendo los negocios pues ambos son muy rentables.
texts.en:
Erika Lissette is 29 years old, and is caring for 2 children. She has previous experience with microfinance loans, and has shown that good management is the key to the success of her business. Her business activities include the sale of cosmetics and the butchering of pigs. She is a young woman who likes to diversify her activities continually, and she has to keep learning different business skills in order to improve her economic situation. She sells her products in the street, but always with the hope of improving herself. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase basic materials such as lipsticks, perfumes, colognes, cosmetic treatments, and other items. It is her dream to maintain both businesses, as they are both quite profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., a 57-year old married woman who lives in Talusan, Brgy. Bulanon, Sagay City, earns a living by operating her own fishing business. Rosita’s husband, Carlo, is a fisherman, and they have eight children who are school-age and adult-age, including a daughter working abroad. They own two vehicles which their two sons take care of for their business, and they also have a sugarcane farm.

Rosita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the assistance of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by starting a fishing business, now earning an average monthly income of Php10,000. A member in good standing, Rosita's previous loan of Php29,500 was used to fund operations for her fishing business and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now requesting her 16th loan in the amount of Php29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital, Rosita is working hard to achieve her dreams for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia  es viuda vive con su hijo en casa propia en la zona tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Eulalia tiene ingresos de renta y además se dedica a la venta de comida mejorando así la calidad de vida de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de insumos por cantidad para su negocio de venta de comida y no comprar al por menor y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Eulalia is widowed and lives with her son her home, which she owns, in the earthquake prone area of La Paz. Eulalia has rental income and also sells food, thus improving her quality of life in her home. The loan will be used to purchase supplies for her food business. By not buying retail goods she will be able to increase her earnings. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The financial analysis carried out shows that she is qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim J. is a 41-year-old businessman; he is married and has six children, 3 boys and 3 girls.  Four of these children are in primary school, and the other two are in secondary school.

Ibrahim has his business in the Krootown community, which is in the western business district. Ibrahim has a tea shop and also sells other items including provisions. He also owns a bakery where he produces bread for the Krootown community. Ibrahim has been producing bread for this community for the past 15 years and in the process has gained a lot of loyal customers. Ibrahim produces quality bread and as a result he has attracted the attention of customers from other communities.

He has been receiving loans from ARD and has a very good loan history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones to expand his shop and to produce more bread to meet the demand of his customers.

Ibrahim intends using the proceeds from this loan to help educate his children and provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of bread flour and provisions

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 55 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a specialized retail store selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Norma joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita B., 45, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando B., a technician, and is also a stay-at-home mother who manages the household while she attends to her business.
Teresita operates a photocopying business. She now finds that there is more need for her services now than previously as customer demand has increased. Her main customers are students, who require her services for their school work. She also has customers who require photocopying for documents, form replication and so forth. Her regular customers are students from the school near her business site and members of the local community. Teresita earns a minimum of 300 PHP profit every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Teresita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy spare parts and pay repair fees for her photocopying machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Teresita dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Pia Laverne

texts.en:
Pia Laverne M. is 18 years old, married and has a baby. She is from the village of Cataggaman Nuevo, a part of Tuguegarao City in Cayagan province of the Luzon islands. Pia Laverne owns and operates a business venture providing motorcycle services to local community members. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Pia Laverne joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pia Laverne from ASKI. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the motorcycle used in her business

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul Z., age 33, lives with her husband and two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She lives in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, with her family. Both of her children attend a local school. Munhzul has been operating a second-hand products business since 2003, after running a grocery trade business for one year. Her husband helps out with her business. 

Her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. In the future, she hopes to have her own workplace. She is a very modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 2,100,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more variety of second-hand goods at wholesale prices in order to increase her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of second-hand goods

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. s 47 years old, married and has one child. She is from the village of Bago, a part of Sindangan municipality, Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Josefa plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been in business for over 29 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Josefa is requesting a new loan, her third, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional seed, seedlings and young plants

loans.name: Agnes Araba Mansah

texts.en: Agnes Araba Mansah K. is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has no formal educational background. She sells porridge made from rice at Elmina. This rice dish is most often served with milk, sugar, boiled or fried eggs, and bread. She is asking for the loan to purchase more rice, milk, and other items to cook for sale. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes wishes to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase more rice, milk and other items to cook for sale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Titong, Brgy. Budlasan, Canlaon City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband, Jose Ceriales, who is 65 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are 14 to 27 years old. Rosalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,500 which she intends to use to buy grocery items for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of her business.  Rosalina T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Nine members form this village loan; the members are from the Traeuy Troeng village in the Kandal province. This village loan selected Mrs. Chamroeun M., 51, as the village bank president. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Chamroeun M. is a farmer who owns two-hectares of rice fields to cultivate rice for a living. She does not have enough money to cultivate her farming. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and gasoline to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Chou Au, 53 years old, works as ice cream seller who is able to earn a little income to support his family. 

They have seven children, one who is an iron welder, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the others are students who also help their mother in farming.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and gasoline to grow rice.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 37 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la enseñanza de capacitación de educación, el es profesor, el socio quiere seguir saliendo adelante como profesional y sacar adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa y uso personal.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a member of the “Ricchary Cusco” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Miguel Angel is 37 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his teacher training job.  He is a teacher.  He would like to continue getting ahead in life as a professional and get his children ahead too.  He is requesting this loan to maintain his home and for personal use.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To maintain his house and for personal use

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and is married with four children between ages 6 and 14.  Elizabeth is well-known in her area for selling cosmetics, mainly body lotion. This is her third year in this business, which is open from 8 am until 7 pm every day.

Elizabeth has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding more cosmetic products. Her neighborhood is the right place to sell cosmetics because there are boarding schools in the area and many students who like to buy cosmetics. With this business expansion, Elizabeth will keep saving for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hijo de 6 años de edad y su madre, tienen casa propia ubicada en Alegría departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 32 años de edad, este negocio lo administra en el mercado municipal de Berlín, con un horario de 6:00am a 5:00pm, desde hace 5 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería faldas, blusas, camisas y pantalones, con la compra estará aumentando el inventario y crecerá su negocio, atenderá de una mejor manera  a los clientes y sus ganancias también serán mejores.

Su objetivo es mantenerse a largo plazo con el negocio, ser responsable y vigilar por el buen funcionamiento de este, para garantizar a su familia una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her 6 year-old son and her mother in their own home which is located in Alegría, in Usulután department.

Ana is 32 years old and her business is selling clothes.  She runs her business in Berlín town market.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm and has been in this business for 5 years.

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants.  With this purchase she will be growing her business and will be able to better serve her customers.  Her profits will also improve.  Her goals are to remain in her business for the long term, to be responsible, to ensure her business runs smoothly and to guarantee a more stable life for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias o mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Llapanchispac Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Sonia is 42 years old, single, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising young animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She then sells them in different established markets and street markets. She wants to expand and improve her business selling young animals and is requesting the loan to purchase animals.

Sonia is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Odilon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Odilón; el tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías como collares,pulseras,aretes,polos,chalinas,guantes de alpaca entre otros productos más ,el socio trabaja de forma independiente y se siente  contento con esta su pequeña empresa ya que le brinda satisfaciones como económicas que es la principal,el socio distribuye a todos sus clientes que le solicitan esto es un negocio del cual el socio se siente muy contento ya que es un dinero extra para él, él socio a la vez trabaja en el municipio de Cusco lleva ya un buen tiempo en este trabajo.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio de artesanía.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Odilón belongs to the Communal Bank “Pachapaccari”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 39 years old and single. Odilón buys and sells handicrafts such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings, pullover shirts, scarves, gloves made of alpaca wool, and other items. He works independently and is happy with his small business since it provides his main source of income. Odilón distributes to all of his customers who order from his business. He is very satisfied now that he has some extra money. At one time, he worked for the city of Cusco but now he enjoys his current job.

Odilón is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his crafts business. He is very happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: Purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Mailyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mailyn owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Mailyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.Mailyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mailyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a 55-year-old, single mother of seven children living in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of her family, with the help of her older children. Her dream is to build a permanent house and to educate her children.

For five years she has been trading cattle. She explains that her start-up capital was from her own savings. She struggles to get a consistent supply of cattle. Her dream is to own a ranch. Jolly intends to use the loan proceeds that she is requesting to purchase cattle for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married with two children, one of whom attends school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the six years; her potential customers are women. Tatu faces a major challenge of seasonality, but during the festive season she receives many customers in her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and invest in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon. She dreams of establishing her own stall in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Flor D. Maria, 38 años D. edad, casada, con 3 hijos.
Flor D. Marìa tiene un negocio D. manualidades / Chocolaterìa; a elL. desD. siempre le ha gustado hacer manualidades y a preparar chocolates y lo hace muy bièn; asì que se animò a abrir un local para atender tantos pedidos.
Flor D. Marìa tiene 3 hijos menores que estudian en un colegio estatal; su esposo es profesor y trabaja para su localidad en el disrito D. Jauja.
El prèstamo que se le ha otorgado es para L. compra D. mejores insumos para confecciòn D. los chocolates.
En L. fotografìa Flor D. Marìa es L. D. L. foto pequeña D. L. parte superior D. L. derecha y esta vestida con camisa color beige (elL. saliò en L. foto granD. detràs D. otra socia)
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte inferior derecha pertenece al socio: Wilfredo C., y no se encontraba presente en L. reunion por estar trabajando.
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte superior izquierda pertenece a Mònica G., no pudo asistir por encontrarse estudiando.
L. foto pequeña D. L. parte inferior izquierda pertenece a Alvina V., elL. en L. fotografìa granD. esta con L. cabeza baja.
El socio Alcides A. no se encuentra en L. fotografìa porque estaba realizando trabajos en L. carretera.
texts.en:
Flor D. Maria is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She has a handicrafts / chocolate business.  Flor D. Maria has always enjoyed making handicrafts and chocolates and she does it very well.  For this reason, she decided to open premises in order to attend to all her orders.  Flor D. Maria has 3 children who are attending high school.  Her husband is a teacher and works in their town, in Jauja district.  Flor D. Maria will use the loan that she has been granted to buy better supplies for making her chocolates.

In the picture, Flor D. Maria is the woman in the small photo on the top right who is wearing a beige-colored shirt (she appears in the larger photo behind another member).
The small photo on the bottom right belongs to Wilfredo C. who wasn't present at the meeting because he was working.
The small photo on the top left belongs to Mónica G. who couldn't attend the meeting because she was studying.
The small photo on the bottom left belongs to Alvina V. who appears in the main photo but her head is lowered.
Alcides A. is not in the photograph because he was doing work on the road.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making chocolate

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a labores ligadas a la agricultura.  Actualmente tiene cultivos de limón, el cual una vez cosechado lo vende a sus vecinos y comerciantes que visitan la zona. Raquel es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, son estas características que le han permitido lograr todo lo que tiene a la fecha. Los ingresos que percibe los invierte en su familia.

Raquel desea comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Raquel, 57, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in the farming Tambogrande District, an agricultural zone located in Piura Region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

She does farming related tasks.  She’s currently farming lemons which, once harvested, are sold to her neighbors and to merchants that tend to visit the area.  Raquel is an enterprising, hard working person.  These characteristics have made it possible for her to attain all she has to date.  Income she earns is invested in her family.

Raquel would like to buy manure and fertilizer for her fields so she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Naluvule Farmers Group

texts.en: 36-year-old G. Simon has been selling food at the Naluvule food market in Mukono for the past 20 years. This happily married father of four took advantage of the farm that his late dad left for him to start a business, which he credits with extricating him out of hard circumstances. He gets most of the crops he sells from his farming gardens. Over the course of time, he has made significant strides, which in many respects have contributed to his longevity in this highly competitive business. Weekly, he says this business generates 300,000 shillings profit. Simon also ekes out more income from his livestock sales business. With this loan, Simon says he wants to purchase more farm inputs like hoes, gumboots, pangas [machetes], etc., to use on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs like hoes, gumboots, pangas [machetes], etc., to use on his farm.

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
Jaime Ramiro tiene 25 años, es soltero vive con la madre y con un  hijo en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

Jaime se dedica a la agricultura siembra cebada, papas, maíz, arveja y trigo el terreno es de sus padres tiene seis cabezas de ganado, cerdos y pollos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y un vehículo.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Jaime Ramiro G. C. is 25 years old, single, and lives with his mother and son in the Canton of Guaranda, located in the Province of Bolívar.  He has one son.

The members of the ‘Grupo de Mujeres Carbón Chinipamba’ Communal Bank live in the community of Carbón Chinipampa, four blocks from the Canton of Guaranda and 20 minutes from the Cooperativa San José office.  The majority of the group members work in agriculture, cattle farming and as merchants.  They grow rice, barley, beans, quinoa, and potatoes and raise animals like dairy cows and barnyard animals.

Jaime works in agriculture growing barley, potatoes, corn, peas and wheat.  The land belongs to his parents and he also has six cattle, pigs and chickens.  He makes his purchases in the Guaranda market and sells his products at the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for his animals, which will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces difficulties such as pests, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy land and a vehicle.

He likes to play sports and participate in the carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for ten years and employs two farmhands. He sells his milk on the local market. He earns additional income from small-scale farming of tea. He is also employed as a guard in one of the local schools. 

Charles has made his second loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000Kes. He intends to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his farming activities in future by acquiring additional dairy cows.

Charles is 31 years old and married with two children aged two and four years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 40 years old, married and a mother of 3. She has a food production business, particularly selling processed foods in her village. She has been in this business for almost 2 years and earns 5,000 PHP monthly. Analiza is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients to make more processed foods to sell. She would like to continue using loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to make more processed foods to sell

loans.name: Miriam Genoveva

texts.es:
Miriam de 46 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 26, 22 y 11 años que estudia en colegio particular. Se dedica a ala venta de confitería.

Comenzó su actividad desde pequeña vendía en productos en lo estadios pero ahora lo hace en su casa para cuidar a la mama. Tiene dos sobrinos que le ayuda a vender labora de 9H00 a 11H30 am y de 2H00 pm a 4H30pm.. vende confites sorbetes y varios cosas. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas materiales para sus ventas como sorbetes, confites. En un futuro desea comprar maquinas para realizas sus trabajos y mejorar mas sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 46 years old.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo (which is named after the 'Guazuma ulmifolia' species of tree), in Guayaquil.  Guasmo is a popular neighborhood of working-class people.  It used to be a large estate.  Miriam is single and has three children aged 26, 22 and 11 who attend a private school.  Miriam's business is selling confectionery.

Miriam started her business when she was young, selling products in stadiums.  Now she makes her sales from her home, so that she can care for her mom.  She has two nephews who help her to make her sales.  She works from 9.00am to 11.30am and from 2.00pm to 4.30pm.  She sells candies, sherbets (sorbets) and other products.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more supplies for her sales such as sherbets and candies.  In the future, Miriam would like to buy machines to carry out her work and further improve her income.

loans.use: to buy candies and sherbets (sorbets)

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS es un banco que ya está en su sexto ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes 6 Mujeres y 3 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta material escolar, confección y otros, y la Sra. OLGA es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella se dedica a la venta D. material escolar  hace bastante tiempo y con el préstamo  comprara material escolar D. diferentes variedades y aumento D. su capital D. trabajo  y D. esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad D. vida, es una persona muy responsable con ganas D. superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurs' bank "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS" is a bank that is now in its sixth lending cycle.  The Bank is maD. up of of nine members; six women and three men.  The women traD. and sell school supplies, clothing and other things.

Señora Olga is president of the bank and has three school-age children.  She has been selling school supplies for some time and with the loan, she will purchase different varieties of school supplies and increase her working capital.  In this way she will improve her income and quality of life.

She is a very responsible person with the desire to excel, and she is grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to buy a variety of school supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has three children ranging in age from one to twelve. She is a greengrocer selling groceries in a busy market. Rose has been running this business for seven years. She plans to use this loan to buy more stock and expand her business. 

This is Rose's second loan with SMEP. She is a good client that pays back her loan well. In the future, Rose hopes to supply big stores.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery business

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y seis hijos, él es agricultor, tiene 25 años de estar cultivando maíz, aprendió desde muy joven cuando colaboraba con su padre, hoy en día realiza los cultivos como un medio para obtener ingresos.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de 6 sacos de abono, y pesticidas, esta compra le ayudara mucho para fortalecer la siembra y tener buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es tener una producción abundante y sana, para poder comercializar una parte y generar ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and six children. He is a farmer who has been growing corn for 25 years. He learned from working with his father since he was very young. Today, he farms as a way to make a living.

He is requesting a loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer, as well as pesticides. This purchase will help him a great deal to strengthen his crops and to have a good harvest.

Juan's goal is to have an abundant and healthy yield so that he can sell part of it to generate income to cover his and his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and six sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been a farmer for more than 20 years. Together with her husband, she tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato, where she plants rice crops. Elena also grows fruit trees and sells her harvest at the market.

Elena works hard to support her family of a husband and three children. She applied for a loan so that she could help fund their farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

In the future, Elena hopes to be rich. She also hopes for her children to finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mbuko

texts.en:
Mbuko is a 49-year-old married man. He has 8 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 29 years. 

Mbuko operates a retail shop where he sells household consumables in a trading centre. He has been involved in this business for 19 years. He describes his biggest business challenges as price fluctuations and demanding clients.

Mbuko will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock to his retail shop. His hope for the future is to be able to open a wholesale shop and diversify into the water business.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. Nancy has been in this business for 5 years now.

Nancy requested a 30,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and ingredients for her business. In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Tomas le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, arena y pintura especial para la vivienda, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su empleo.
Don Tomas planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en producción,  es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Ya que su esposa la señora Estela se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijos.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio y  la calidad de vida de su familia y evitar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Tomas' home needs some finishing work carrying out to both the outside and the inside.  He is requesting a loan to buy material such as cement, sand and special paint for the house.  Right now, he does not have the money he needs.  He will carry out this improvement work outside of his normal work hours.

Tomas plans to repay his loan with some of the money that he makes from his job in a factory.  This is the source of income that he has for supporting his family.  His wife, Estela, takes care of their children.

Tomas would like to improve his property, improve his family's quality of life and avoid illnesses.

loans.use: to carry out some finishing work to the outside and inside of his home (paint)

loans.name: Nasreen Naz's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Naz is 51 years old  and owns and operates a seamstress business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. 
She is the mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is 19 years old and completed his education to the 5th standard. Now he operates an animal food business. He contributes to his family financially from his work. Nasreen Naz's daughter is 11 years old and stays at home. 
Her husband is a daily wage laborer.
  
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food in a larger quantity for selling.  
Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy animal food for selling

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is a 37-year-old married man with a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past five years, Khai has been supporting his family by making iron doors. He also has been running a small general store to supplement his income. Now he plans to take a loan to buy a greater range and quantity of common products such as foods and beverage to increase the stock of his store. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to offer a greater range of products to attract new customers and better meet the needs of existing customers. He hopes that this will enable him to earn more money to cover the cost of family expenses. In the future he hopes to save more money to improve his family's living conditions and reinvest in his current business.

loans.use: to buy a greater range of basic goods such as food and beverages to stock his general store.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is from the village of Kindzati, Kartli Region, East Georgia. She is 65 years old and lives with her family: her 44-year-old son, her daughter-in-law, and three grandchildren who are 16, 22, and 23. The main source of the income for Tina’s family is agriculture. They have two milk cows and Tina produces cheese that she sells to local dairy retailers. Along with the dairy farm, the family owns 4.5 hectares of land where they grow wheat, maize, beans, garlic, and onions. The family sells their harvested products locally. Tina also runs a small grocery store in the village and her granddaughter works there as a salesperson. 

Tina is requesting a loan to purchase two milk cows. This will enable her to produce and sell 100% more cheese and will significantly increase the income of the family. Also, small part of her loan (up to 20%) will be used for purchasing merchandise for the family grocery store to expand the offerings and increase sales. 

Tina plans to use her increased profit to purchase necessary household goods to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким несмотря на свои молодые годы более 10 лет занимается предпринимательством, то есть купле продажей одеял, покрывал и т.д. Он женат и у них трое детей. В бизнесе помогает ему его добрая жена. За товаром он ездит сам в городе Бишкек и привозит хорошие товары. После смерти матери его отец передал свой бизнес сыну и с тех пор Хаким стал успешным бизнесменом. Займ запрашивает для расширения ассортимента товаров. Заранее благодарит ИМОН и КИВА за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Despite his young age, Hakim has spent more than ten years working in his business: selling blankets, bedspreads and other items. He is married and has three children. His kind wife helps him with the business. He personally travels to Bishkek to purchase quality goods. After the death of his mother, his father passed on the business to Hakim, and he has become a successful businessman. He is requesting a loan to expand his selection of products. He thanks in advance IMON and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase goods with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is 45 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 5 children.

Lito works in the fishing industry and sells/catches fish for living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested loan of PHP50,000 to purchase fishnets and a fishing boat for her fishing business.

Lito has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Lito hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and a fishing boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en: Gerel is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and and his two children are school students. He started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2009. He is a trusted supplier to many shops. However, due to the machinery, his work is slow. Therefore, he is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy sewing machinery. Gerel is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My business is going well; however, my work is very slow and I'm beginning to lose customers."

loans.use: to buy sewing machinery.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 48 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has earned a living by offering pedicure and manicure services.

Araceli has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional materials needed for her business.

Araceli hopes to see her pedicure and manicure business grow.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pedicure and manicure business.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Sak, 29, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Sak is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a farmer. Sak is requesting a loan of US $500 to run a grocery store at home. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Sak would like to use any additional income to send children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to run a grocery store at home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha se dedica a la venta de papa en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por las amas de casa de la ciudad de La Paz,  es una clienta antigua que trabajo con el banco Kantutitas, luego trabajo con crédito individual ella vuelve a la institución después de un año y medio y solicita crédito que esta destinado al incremento de capital y sacar los papeles de su puesto de venta, el esposo el sr. Braulio es albañil contratista actualmente se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de El Alto, ambos aportan para el gasto de la familia, el domicilio de la Sra.
