Martha se encuentra ubicado en la zona de las lomas por lo que se pudo  observar es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde las seis de la mañana sale a comprar sus productos la variedad de papas por quintales,  para poder venderlo  y también poner al día los papeles de su puesto de venta,  también pela papa 5 arrobas por día para una pensión que se encuentra cerca a su puesto y así tener otro ingreso extra, La Sra. Martha se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Martha sells potatoes in one of the markets most popular with housewives in La Paz.  She had worked with Kantutitas bank for years and then she worked with an individual loan.  She returned to the institution after a year and a half and requested a loan to increase her working capital and to get her documents in order for her stand.  Her husband, Braulio, is a contracted construction worker and he is working in El Alto.  Both pay for the family expenses.  Martha’s home is on the hills in the zone.  

As you can see she is a very hardworking person since she goes out in the mornings at 6 to buy the potatoes by quintales (a weight of about 100 pounds) to sell them and get her documents in order.  She also peels 5 arrobas (a weight of about 25 pounds) of potatoes per day for a small hotel near her stand and she gets extra income for that.  Martha is grateful for the support offered her by the institution.
.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to get her papers in order for her stand

loans.name: Chien

texts.en: Chien takes loans out for her son, Tung, who is student at the Natural Resource and Environment University. After graduation in 2013, he wants to be an environmental technical engineer and work for the environmental protection department in Bac Ninh Province. To make the dream come to true, he is studying well to have good results. Therefore, his mother wants to borrow a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay tuition fees and buy other supplies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy supplies.

loans.name: Julienne Adjouavi

texts.fr: Julienne Adjouavi est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Luc. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne Adjouavi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Julienne Adjouavi a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Julienne Adjouavi vend depuis une six ans des céréales. Julienne Adjouavi vend aussi de la nourriture de façon secondaire. Julienne Adjouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne Adjouavi sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des céréales.

loans.name: Tunik

texts.ru: Туник добрая женщина. Ей 50 лет. Она заботливая мать 7 детей. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Она сама решает все проблемы семьи и очень нуждается в источнике дохода. Туник решила начать свой бизнес скотоводством и таким образом зарабатывать на жизнь. Доход ее детей не большой. Они живут бедно. Туник воспитала своих детей в духе патриотизма и все ее дети порядочные люди. Ее старший сын обещал ей помочь введению бизнеса. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и нуждается вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Tunik is a kind woman. She is 50 years old. She is an attentive mother to seven children. Her husband died several years ago. She solves her family's problems by herself and really needs a source of income. Tunik decided to start her own business in the field of cattle breeding. In that way, she hopes to make a living. Her children's incomes are small. They live in poverty. Tunik raised all of her children with civic and national pride. As such, all of her children are stand-up individuals. Her eldest son promised to help her run her business. She participated in the course "Achieve Success," organized by the Association of Businesswomen. She received a certificate. She is requesting a loan for 5000 somoni to purchase cattle. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to organize her new business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 52 years old and has two children. Ma. Theresa is married and has one child still in school.

Ma. Theresa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has recently completed her third cosmetology course at the Mifex MERIT Centers. She has learned how to cut hair, do make up and give manicures and pedicures. Now that she has the skills, she is ready to start her own beauty salon with the help of this loan. She will first buy the necessary materials for her manicures and pedicures, which include nail polish, soap and clippers. She is 19 years old but could not start her college studies because of financial restraints. She has been married for 2 years and does not have children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy materials to start her beauty salon

loans.name: Hidjran

texts.en: Hidjran is 36 years old, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village, is married and has children. She has run this business for 6 years. In the beginning of her business she borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a pregnant cow. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 cows in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married with four children. The educational and health needs of his family have continued to be his motivation. With his previous loans he succeeded in acquiring customers. His good customers services skills provided his community especially school children, with second-hand shoes.

With his experience in the field, given a loan of $600, John plans to buy second hand shoes in bulk to serve his customers during schools re-opening. He plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Sale of used shoes

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Ms Telesia is a young lady of 24 years of age with four kids. She didn’t have a good education and is a school dropout. She prefers  planting a vegetable garden that is a source of income to help out in raising her kids and taking care of her family needs. But apart from that, she still needs some financial help to buy the very needed supplies for her business such as fertilizer, weed killers and other vegetables seeds. She has  joined  the Good Samaritan program and hopes to get her 1st loan of $750. She is very much excited about the prospect of her business growing in the future.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 20 years old and is unmarried. She lives with her family. Selling clothes on credit has been Lia's business recently. She has to finance her family and help her parents to cover their daily needs. She usually earns $10 per week and requests a $50 loan to expand her business. She works energetically and hopes she can afford to send her brother to school. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia C. lives in her uncle’s home on Pinocho street in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. She is a street vendor who sells candy and cookies around the nearby schools. She is requesting a loan in order to buy toys. She intends to broaden her business this Christmas season in order to generate more revenue because this business is her sole source of income.

Because of her good credit history, she is able to request a new loan. She has been a member of IMPRO since the beginning of the year and has already paid off her previous debts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvia vive en casa de sus tíos en la calle Pinocho de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la venta de dulces y galletas ambulando en los colegios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar juguetes. Para la época de navidad Silvia amplia su actividad para generar más ingresos ya que es su único medio de subsistencia.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que su historial de pagos es muy bueno. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el comienzo de este año y ya recibió dos créditos anteriores los cuales han sido cancelados en su totalidad

loans.use: Purchase of toys for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria has always been very good at business, her diligence and perseverence has allowed her success in each activity that she occupied. For the last few month she decided to establish a business selling fuel and gas, materials that she gets from the border with Bolivia and that she sells to a select customer base in the city of Juliaca. With this new activity she has been able to proviD. better for her family. She is a mother of four sons, two of which are dependent on her, her husbands sells cookies/biscuits and candy, mostly to various cities in the area surrounding Puno. The dream of these hardworking parents is to proviD. a good education and good example for their sons so they will become valuable professionals in the future. With this opportunity Maria is asking for a loan which she plans to invest in her shop, and with this business considerably improve their living conditions. Maria and her family are hoping for your prompt response.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María, siempre fue una mujer D. negocios, su diligencia y perseverancia la llevaron a tener éxito en cada actividad que ha desempeñado; hace sólo algunos meses decidió incursionar en el negocio D. venta D. combustible y gas, mercadería que trae D. la frontera con Bolivia y los venD. a su selecta clientela en la ciudad D. Juliaca, con esta nueva actividad está logrando conseguir mejores utilidades para su familia.Ella es madre D. cuatro hijos dos D. ellos aún dependientes, su esposo trabaja vendiendo galletas y golosinas al por mayor en las distintas ciudades del departamento D. Puno. El deseo que tienen estos laboriosos padres es brindarles una buena educación y ejemplo a sus hijos para que en el futuro sean hombres profesionales con buenos valores.En esta oportunidad Maria solicita un préstamo D. dinero que tiene proyectado invertir en su mercadería, considera que con este negocio logrará mejorar considerablemente su condición D. vida.María y su familia esperan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to offer larger quantities of fuel

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sath H., 32, is married with one daughter and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her children. To generate an income, she has to go to her farm and normally she generates $1 a day in profit. Her husband Mr. Lun Vandy, 36, works as a government official making on average around $2 a day.

Mr. Lun, however, wants to borrow some money to open another business. He plans to breed pigs and resell them for profit. To make the business run successfully, Mr. Lun is requesting a loan from Kiva of $500. If that business produces more money, he will send his daughter to university.

loans.use: purchase pigs to breed to make more profit

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
A. Silvia is a fishmonger. She is married and has three children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then sells the it to her customers.

She wants to expand her business and is asking for $525.00 so that she can buy more fresh fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 20 years old and is single with 1 child, age 4. Aisha owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda is a woman who diligently operates a small dry goods store out of her home. Her store is very popular and is frequently visited by her neighbors. In her store, they find everything they need at a very reasonable price and very friendly service. Since Amanda's dry goods store is one of just a few small stores that exist in the area, she often receives suggestions and requests for goods she does not carry. She wants to begin to stock these items in order to increase her income and better serve her customers. With this objective in mind, Amanda is asking for your help to obtain a loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Amanda, es una dama que con constancia y mucho esfuerzo ha ido implementando su pequeña bodeguita ubicada en su domicilio. Actualmente esta tiendita es muy visitada y solicitada por sus vecinos, quienes encuentran en este lugar todo lo que requieren y con precios sumamente cómodos y sobre todo una buena atención.Esta bodeguita de abarrotes es una de las pocas tienditas que existe en su localidad, es por ello que goza con una gran cantidad de solicitudes y sugerencias, solicitudes que desea complacer para mejorar sus ingresos y el servicio a sus clientes, Amanda. Con ese objetivo en mente recurre a vosotros en búsqueda de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase more goods in order to make her little bodega more popular

loans.name: Dios Es Esperanza (God Is Hope) Group 3-4

texts.en: Jimena has three children, ages 7, 4 and 14 months.  She owns a small business selling chicken, beef and vegetables.  Jimena has already completed four loans with Esperanza., and with her fifth one hopes to get that much closer to expanding her business, owning her own home and providing an education for her children.

loans.use: To develop her business and provide for her three young children.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa lives her parents' home in the San Roque area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband, who is a public transportation driver. Jesusa is dedicate to selling consumer products such as bread, candy, beverages, soap, oils, etc., at her convenience store that she rents out at a highway stop. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to diversify her selections. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and her background makes her a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Jesusa vive en la calle San Miguel de Italaque de la zona San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo el cual es chofer de transporte público. Desusa se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo, como ser pan, dulces, refrescos, jabón, aceites, etc., en una tienda que posee en alquiler ubicada en la parada de transito de vehículos interprovinciales. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más variedad de mercaderías y así diversificar sus productos a la venta. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer customers at her convenience store / compra de más variedad de mercaderías para ofrecer al público en su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra, 39 years old, lives in the South of Lebanon close to Tyre. She is a young married woman and the mother of three. Her children describe her as a courageous mother. Zahra owns a cosmetics shop. She needs an amount of USD 1,200 to replace her old car. Her car is an important tool for her business, as she travels a lot to find new products or better deals from suppliers. This is the second time that Zahra has requested a loan from Al Majmoua [Kiva’s Field Partner]. She successfully repaid her previous loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car to replace the old one

loans.name: Behara

texts.en: Behara J.‡ was born in the town of  Stupari in 1964. Behara works in the agriculture and cattle business. Her husband is also employed, earning 400 KM monthly.  This is her first loan from WWI in amount of 1000 KM. Behara will use this loan to buy extra fodder to feed her cow during the winter time. She hopes this will help her cow stay healthy as she is waiting for a calf to be born from her cow.

loans.use: To buy food for the cow

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
This is 58-year-old Alie S.. Alie was born in Fadugu but now lives with his family in Kabala. Alie is married to a businesswoman who sells second hand clothes. Alie and his wife have 15 children. Three are already married; seven are in secondary school and five in primary school. 

Alie was involved in a car accident some years ago. He lost one of his feet in the accident. When he recovered seven months later and resumed work, he developed a special interest and love for the war amputees. He encouraged them to stop begging in the streets and to join him in the tailoring profession. Today, he has about 13 amputees he is training for free in his tailoring shop. 

Alie is seeking a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 ($1200 USD) to buy himself working materials such as cotton, thread, and so forth. Presently, he is in short of sewing machines. Alie will like to buy more sewing machines for his trainees.

Previous loans were the main instrument for the current gains Alie has made in his business. Through his business and with the support of his wife, they are able to meet most of their family's immediate needs.

loans.use: Buy sewing supplies like cotton, sewing machines, and thread

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir K. is 37 years old. He is married with two children. Abdukodir rents out a mini-bus. offering taxi services for the population of his city. Having attended to this business for 10 years, he has gained rich experience. The business is stable and generates the main income for Abdukodir’s family, allowing improving their living conditions.

However, even though the business generates income, it also needs some funding. So now Abdukodir is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher quality services in future. Today he needs to purchase spare parts and to pay for the repair of the mini-van. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. Being the client of IMON for two years almost, Abdukodir had demonstrated himself to be an accurate, reliable client. He thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Spare parts for his mini-van and covering the repairs

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana M. se ha dedicado desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de alimentos específicamente a la venta de carne de cerdo el cual la comercializa en su casa de habitación en su comunidad.

Por medio de este negocio la señora M. puede mantener su hogar compuesto por sus tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos estudia en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad. El propósito por el cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de un cerdo para proceder al destace y vender la carne y a la vez para preparar los alimentos para la venta. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Within the Municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Ana M. has spent the past 5 years selling foods, specializing in pork meats sold from her home to the community.

Through her business, Mrs. M. can maintain her household, made up of her three children. One of them is currently studying in a small school in the community. The reason she sought support from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to obtain a loan to buy a pig to slaughter and sell the meat, and prepare foods for sale. She hopes her loan will be well completed.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Bonanza Village Bank.  Graciela is 47 years old and married. She has seven children. Graciela lives near the Acocro District, in a community located about an hour away. Graciela runs a store from her home, where she and her son sell dry goods, fruits, and vegetables. Graciela also raises animals and farms.

Graciela is asking for a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, sugar, and milk to stock her store.  Graciela’s dreams are for her children to graduate from high school and go to college in Ayacucho, and to offer a wider variety of merchandise in her store. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza. 
Graciela es casada, tiene 47 años y 7 hijos, Graciela vive en el distrito D. Acocro en una comunidad que se encuentra a 1 hora del distrito, Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, fruta, verduras, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hijo. Además Graciela se dedica a la crianza D. animales y agricultura. 
Graciela necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche. 
Los sueños D. Graciela son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios secundarios y luego estudien la universidad en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, tener una tienda mas surtida.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Onakhon

texts.en:
D. Onakhon is 56 years old, married and has a son. Years ago, Onakhon's lack of a stable job and the slow growth of her husband's construction business mean that the family did not have enough money to pay its expenses. This was why Onakhon decided to start her own business seven years ago selling fabrics used to make her nation's favorite style of dresses. Little by little, she has made her business grow, and because she allows her clients to pay in installments her orders are getting bigger and her business is doing well. However, she would like to continue to improve her life (and grow her business) so that her life will be more stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 that she will pay back in six months. With this money, Onakhon will be able to buy seasonal fabrics. Please help her business grow. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fabrics

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo se compone de cuatro integrantes quienes residen en la aldea de Lajero Blanco. María de la Paz Hernández es una señora trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como: jeans, camisas, blusas, ropa de cama y ropa interior de ambos sexos, la cual vende en la comunidad donde vive, tiene un puesto ubicado en la casa de habitación, ahora también vende en excosur es una empacadora de melón. espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, con esta actividad a podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus hijos, dos de ellas estudian y en sus tiempos libres ayudan a su mama en el negocio, el esposo trabaja como albañil en diferentes lugares de la aldea. Ana Isabel Álvarez es una mujer joven, casada, ella y su esposo tienen una hija de seis años. Ana vende golosinas como:enchiladas,tacos,pastelitos y tajaditas de plátano, vende en el mismo lugar donde vive, ella  a podido crecer en su negocio, sus ventas han mejorado, sale todas las tardes a vender sus golosinas recorre toda la aldea en donde termina de vender todo el producto. las verduras como: tomates, cebollas, chiles y repollo los compra a carros que pasan por la aldea, los condimentos y otras cosas las compra en la pulpería del mismo lugar. Espera seguir creciendo en su negocio. María Luisa Madariaga se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace cuatro años  antes vendía su producto solo en el  lugar donde vive, ahora su negocio ha crecido, ahora vende también en excosur y promangle, esta actividad le a generado ingresos con los cuales a ayudado a su esposo con los gastos de la vivienda, es madre de tres hijos, una está en la escuela en cuarto grado los demás están pequeños, los cuales deja con su mama cuando sale a vender, el esposo se dedica a la soldadura, por el tipo de trabajo que él tiene pasa muy poco en el hogar. Etelvina Sarai se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace cinco años ella viaja a la ciudad de Choluteca cada quince días donde compra ropa de niño, dama y hombre, ella sale todos los días a vender también vende en excosur antes solo vendía en la aldea donde vive ahora viaja a excosur por que su negocio a crecido, esto le a permitido vivir mejor y colaborar más en su hogar, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura tienen un hijo .
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four members who live in the Lajero Blanco village. María de la Paz Hernández is a working woman who sells new clothing, such as jeans, shirts, blouses, bedclothes, and underwear. She sells her merchandise in the community where she lives and has a stand set up in her house. Currently, she also sells her goods at a melon packing company called Excosur. She hopes to continue growing her business, since it has allowed her to help her husband improve the livelihood of their children. She has two girls who are currently in school and they help their mother with her business in their free time. Her husband is a construction worker who works at various locations in the village. Ana Isabel Álvarez is a young, married woman with a 6 year old girl. Ana sells snacks such as enchiladas, tacos, small cakes, and banana chips. She sells her goods out of the her house and her business and sales have grown to the point that she spends every afternoon selling her snacks. The entire village comes to buy and she runs out of all of her products. She wants to purchase vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, chilis, and cabbage from the sellers in cars that pass through the village. Also, she wants to buy condiments and other goods that she can buy from the local store. With these, she hopes to continue growing her business. María Luisa Madariaga has been selling food and snacks for 4 years. Previously, she sold her products exclusively out of her home, but since her business has grown, she now also sells in Excosur and Promangle. This has generated income that has helped her husband with the household expenses. She is the mother of three children, one is in 4th grade and the others are not yet old enough for school. She leaves her children with her mother when she leaves to go sell her goods. Her husband is a welder and is not able to spend very much time at home. Etelvina Sarai has been selling new clothing for 4 years. She travels to the city of Choluteca every 15 days to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing. She leaves the house every day to sell her clothes in Excosur. Previously, she only sold in the village where she lives, but now she travels to Excosur because her business has grown. This has allowed her to live better and contribute more to the household. Her husband works in the agriculture industry and they have one child.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new men's, women's, and children's clothing, underwear, dishes, glasses, condiments, vegetables, meats, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Amirkhan

texts.en: Amirkhan is 45 years old. He lives in Khachmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. He is married and has four children. He has 10 years of experience in the orchard business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for improving his orchard business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bobosaid

texts.en:
S. Bobosaid has worked with metal for 15 years in his own shop. He makes iron doors, gates and grating with fences. He's the father of 4 children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools and input materials, iron products, so he can provide better service to his customers and expand his business.

Bobosaid applied to IMON International for a loan of $ 1500 USD for the term of 12 months. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. Bobosaid is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of  iron products necessary for his business

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Khurshed has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Khurshed is married and has three children to provide for. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he's approached IMON International to apply for a loan.  The loan will allow him to purchase young cattle and to feed them, which in turn will increase his income from the milk, meat, horn, and other goods provided by these cattle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
"A hardworking woman" best describes Elma B., 42 years old, married, and living at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children. Her husband is a mere fisherman. She tries her best to provide for the needs of her family; that’s why she engaged herself in a sari-sari store business. In order to have enough capital, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2008 and was able to start her business.

Elma has already taken out other loans several times. Now, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos to buy additional inventory for her store. In the future, she wants to renovate her house and have her store expanded into a bigger space. Elma will be fulfilled as a parent if all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: Store inventory

loans.name: Mith's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in Ratanak Commune in Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Mith S., is 32 years old and a local fruit seller. She usually goes to buy different kinds of fruit in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them at a local market near her house. She is married to Mao Sin, 42, who buys motorcycles from people in rural areas, then cleans them up in his home and resells them.

This humble couple generates a daily income of approximately $6 per day to meet their family's needs and especially to make sure their one child gets a good education. Mith S. is running her investment smoothly.  In order to make the business more successful,  Mith S. would like a loan for capital to buy more fruit. The other four borrowers are:

C., who is looking for a loan to increase her ability to sell grocery items.

K., who is a staff member of Christian Association and is seeking a loan to repair her old house.

S.,  a local perfume seller who would like to buy additional perfume to sell.

S., who sells roasted eggs, and is looking to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase sales of fruit, groceries, perfume, roasted eggs

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La señora Filomena trabaja  desD. el año 2005, empezó con un grupo solidario, y ahora trabaja individualmente, tiene su tienda en su propia casita, vive con su esposo, quien tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja como taxi, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad e independientes. Es una cliente muy puntual y responsable, el crédtio será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes para la tienda y comprará también llantas para la movilidad del esposo.
texts.en:
Filomena has worked since 2005; she started with a solidarity group, now she works individually. She has a store in her own house, where she lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver. Her children are already grown and independent. She is a very punctual and responsible client. Her credit will be invested in the purchase of groceries for the store, and also to buy tires for her husband's taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of groceries (rice, pasta, flour) and tires for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Rasac

texts.fr: Rasac A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est menuisier depuis 4 ans, et est compté parmi les meilleurs de la zone. Ses œuvres sont de qualité. Rasac souhaite avec ce crédit accroître le rendement de son activité en achetant les outils de travail surtout les planches pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Rasac A., age 39, is married and the father of 2 children. He's been a furniture maker for 4 years, and is among the best in his area. His works are of quality. Rasac wishes to use this loan to increase his productivity, by buying work tools and, especially, planks that he needs to create his works.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and planks

loans.name: 5 De Junio Group

texts.en:
The "Fifth of June" group is made up of twelve women, the majority of whom live in the Villa Dolores zone. This zone is characterized by one-story adobe homes.

The board of this group is made up of Mrs. Esperanza C. M., Mrs. Rosmery C. L. and Mrs. Carmen Rosa T. A.. The majority of women in this group are tailors, shawl knitters, store keepers, food makers, and vegetable sellers in the very competitive market. Also, some members sell hardware material, books, legal coca leaves, and backpacks.

The women need loans to buy material for their businesses, which is in some cases cloth, thread, and wool. They are very excited to work with AgroCapital and recently approached the institution to ask for their first loan. The majority of the women all know each other, and it is a very happy group.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites N. is a hardworking woman residing in the simple village of Sili Aurora, Isabela. She is married to Salvador N. who is a farmer and a jeepney transport (small bus) driver. Their major source of income comes from the production of rice and vegetables on their farm. Marites sells the vegetables harvested in their vegetable farming whereas their harvested rice is kept for their stock of rice for the whole year.

Marites used to sell their vegetable produce at a wholesale price in their public market. Because she wanted their farming to improve and because she wanted her vending to expand further, Marites is requesting PHP 15,000 from Kiva to use as additional capital to also buy their neighbors’ produce to sell.

Marites’ desire is to continue to support the college education of her two children which motivates her to improve her vegetable production and vending business to increase her income. This way, Marites will assure her children an education and satisfy them in their daily basic needs.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Tamansane Group

texts.en:
This is Samuel I. K., Augusta K. and Nanah K., who named their group Tamansane. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses. However, having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 900,000 each to help them further improve their businesses.

Samuel I. K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Samuel is a photographer. With this loan, he will buy two cartons of film and sell to colleagues at the studio. A carton of film cost Le 400,000 in Freetown.

Samuel was born in Makeni city, thirty-four years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. Samuel’s children are still young and are attending primary schools.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa O. est une femme âgée de 51 ans mariée avec 4 enfants. Elle habite à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle fait la commercialisation des céréales. D’après ses expériences en stockage elle avait réalisé qu’il y a beaucoup de bénéfices dans le stockage. Donc avec ce crédit elle voudrait multiplier ses stocks de mais et voudrait ajouter le stock de piment. Avec ce prêt également elle voudrait ajouter la vente des produits de consommation crue. Elle vise utiliser ses profits dans sa propre santé, la scolarisation de ses enfants et plus tard construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Yawa O. is a 51-year-old woman and is married with 4 children. She lives in Adéta, a town located approximately 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works in the distribution of grain. Her experience in grain storage has helped her realize that storage is a profitable area. Therefore, with the requested loan, she would like to increase her corn stock, as well as add pepper stock. With this loan, she would also like to start selling products for raw consumption. She is planning to use the generated profits to improve her own health, to school her children and to build her own house.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn and Pepper Storage

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace N. is 37 years old ,wisdow with two children  with the following years old :
12 and 9.
She lives in  Rurindo district,southern province of Rwanda where she owns sewing machine.
Peace starts her business everyday from 8h00 AM to 7h00PM;the purpose of this loan requested in Vision Finance Company is to expand her business through purchasing the many new sewing machines .
Before requesting this new  loan  she was not able get more profit ,by now she hopes to earn extra profit which will help her to save money so that she gets  more food for her children and to pay  school fees for them.

loans.use: Purchasing new sewing machines

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. is currently in the business of selling cake for kids from her home. She is 31 years old and is married with three children and her children go to school.

Lay K.’s husband has been a local construction foreman for years. He now needs more capital to purchase more heavy construction materials for his business. Therefore, Lay K. decided to seek a loan which will allow her husband to order his material.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy more heavy construction materials

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat H. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest four children, two daughters and two sons, all attend a local secondary school and his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. 

H. operates a small billiards area at the local market in his town. He owns two billiards tables located in an outdoor area of the market that people can use when they come to shop. His tables earn on average 10,000 tugrugs (about $7) profit a day. H. started his business in 2004 and has enjoyed operating the billiards tables. His business is a popular spot in the market, but because it is outdoors, he cannot operate in the wintertime. 

H. hopes he can save enough money in the near future to own his own indoor place for his billiards tables. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase coal to heat his home and a cow to eat this winter.

loans.use: To heat his home and to buy a cow to eat this winter

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en: Marjolyn O. lives in the village of Prk. Makawili, Barangay Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is 49 years old and married to Ramon O., who currently works as a fish vendor in their local community. The couple is blessed with four children who are 16 to 26 years old, with the three younger kids still attending school. Her most cherished aspiration is to provide her children, through her own efforts and hard work, with a good life and a good education that will empower them to have gainful work and a bright future. When Marjolyn’s children were so much younger, she realized that her husband's income would not be sufficient to sustain the growing needs of their family, especially in relation to her dream of sending her children to college. This is why she decided to go into business for herself by starting a general store. In 2001, when Marjolyn wanted to expand her business, she decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon. From the loan assistance she received, she was able to enlarge her product offerings and thereby increase her income capacity, which now averages PHP 8,000 net profit. Her increased income enabled her to invest in other businesses as the years went by and now she has a fishing boat that provides additional income for her and her family. For her last loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marjolyn borrowed PHP 15,000 which she used as additional income for both her general store and her fishing business. Now that she has fully repaid that loan within its loan term, she is again applying to renew her loan for the same amount of PHP 15,000 to use as working capital for her two businesses. She hopes to be able to buy some household appliances and have her house repaired with the income she earns from this loan. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her general store and fishing business

loans.name: Sarantungalag

texts.en:
B. Sarantungalag is 44 years old and lives with her son in an apartment in the Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her son is 17 years old and attends the local high school. Sarantungalag operates a garment making business out of a rented stall at a small trading center in her town. She both designs and produces all of the clothes herself. She travels to the capital city of her province 2 to 3 times a month to purchase new materials for her business. Sarantungalag previously worked as a dressmaker for a different clothing business. During this time she gained much experience and skill in her trade. Today, her business is well known throughout her community and her customers like her business because she can produce clothing specific to their needs. Sarantungalag works hard to grow her business and provide quality clothes to her customers. Her business is very important to her as it is the only source of income for her and her son. She says, "All I want is to be able to provide for my son's education so that he will become a successful person." Sarantungalag is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to pay her son's tuition fees.



About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia M. is from the village of Santa Rosa, Gamu,Isabela. She is 40 years old. Lucrecia is married and has children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Lucrecia earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lucrecia is requesting a loan of 40000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Buseina

texts.en:
Buseina R. is currently in the business of selling onions and tomatoes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits to sell. Buseina is 30 years old and married; her husband is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El señor Dionicio G. R. tiene 53 años y vive en la localidad de Mallco Chapi a unos 21 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Dionicio está casado con la señora Evarsita por más de 23 años y tienen un hijo de 20 años que vive con ellos y a demás de ayudar con el cuidado de las vacas también está estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Dionicio se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y trabajaba sembrando diferentes productos en sus tierras. En esta casa es donde tiene 5 vacas lecheras que son su mayor fuente de ingreso.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos. También será destinado para el pago de una acción del pozo de agua que construirán en la zona para el riego de sus tierras.

Dionicio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su esposa y a su hijo, ya que su casa por el momento no cuenta con muchas comodidades o con los servicios necesarios. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Dionicio G. R., 53, lives in the Mallco Chapi area, which is about 21km from the city of Cochabamba. He has been married to Evarista for over 23 years and they have a 20 year-old son that lives with them. Their son helps him care for the cows in addition to studying at an institute in Cochabamba. Dionicio is a raw milk dairy farmer and also grows various crops on his lands. He has 5 dairy cows at home and they are his main source of income. The funding will be used to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase milk production and thereby his earnings. It will also be used to pay for a share in the water well that will be dug in his area in order to water his fields. Dionicio tells us that his gretest dream is to provide his wife and son with the most comfort possible since his house, for the moment, does not have many comforts nor basic services. He also tells us that he'd like to use his next loan to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and to pay for a share of water usage rights from the well to be built in the area where he lives.

loans.name: Madia's Group

texts.en:
Madia is a 56-year-old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Madia has been working as a seamstress since 1974. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread for her business. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid her loans on time. 

Madia is special in her work because she is known for her good quality of work and punctuality in repairing clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have any difficulties. Madia decided to continue her business because she likes it and has a lot of experience. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase a new and more sophisticated sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Al Amir Abdel Fatah

texts.en:
Al Amir Abdel Fatah is a 43-year-old married man with two young children. He has owned a computer shop since 2008 with a previous seven years of experience in this field. He is the only provider of his family with this business.

Al Amir Abdel Fatah sells and repairs computers in addition of buying mobile phones and rechargeable cards to make a good income. Today, he is requesting $1,200 to buy computers and phones needed to fill his shop and attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy more computers and phones

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn B. is a woman who loves to be with children. Aside from being so busy attending to her own three children, ages from eight to 12 years old, she is also busy teaching other children in their community about religion. When Jocelyn decided to join ASHI, she first asked her husband for his opinion.  With her husband’s approval, she joined the group of five women in their village who have the same intention as hers. After she was recognized as a member, she submitted her request for a loan, which she will use to purchase a hog/pig for fattening. After four months of raising her hog/pig, she will be able to see her profit because by then, the hog will be sold either live or slaughtered. Once it is sold, Jocelyn will get her capital from it and will again buy another hog.  With that opportunity, Jocelyn feels happy that through the ASHI and Kiva partnership, there is a possibility for her to be funded with a much larger amount of loans in the future to be able to really grow her business. That will allow her to have more income, which will be used to support her dream of graduating her children from college and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase hog/pig for fattening.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan M. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jonathan owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jonathan is just starting this business.
In 2010, Jonathan joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Jonathan plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey D. is 48 years old and a villager in Lieb village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Hun, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm crop. Thus, Mrs. Srey D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds to support her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Sarorn Hun is a fisherman who can make a little income to support his family. Mrs. Srey D. is the mother of two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de vêtements spécialement des costumes vestes, elle s’approvisionne à l’étranger. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, elle approche les gens  dans les entreprises, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de personnes qui travail dans les banques et sociétés privées. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les commandes de ses clients. Elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour l’achat de 10 boubous et 03 boubous.
texts.en:
Kokoè's income generating activity is the sale of clothes, in particular suits and jackets. She gets her supply from abroad. She is a door-to-door saleswoman and approaches people at their workplace. Most of her customers work in banks and privately hold companies. Kokoè's inventory is too low to meet her customers' demand. She came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy two batches of bubus (African dresses for both women and men), consisting of 10 and 3 items respectively.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Kech's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kech Khun is 44 years old and is the leader of a group loan. She was selected by four members who are located in Char village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Kech Khun and her husband, Mr. Sok Son, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow vegetables for a living. Mrs. Kech Khun is now requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a house. This couple has five children; one is seamstress in a garment factory, one is a barber and the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To add her savings to build a house.

loans.name: Mourice Odhiambo

texts.en:
Mourice Odhiambo K. is 45 years old, a husband, and the father of five children. He lives In Migori Kenya where he sells shoes and stationery, a business he started in 2002 after quitting his job.

Mourice travels to Nairobi twice a month to purchase his stock. He is looking forward to expanding his business by increasing his stock. He wishes to obtain a loan of Ksh 50,000 to achieve this and to be able to earn considerable income in order to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase his stock to expand his business

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis, de 45 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridas hijas y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de abarrotes de Gladis es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos y clientes, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y para ella lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. En adelante espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio. Este su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gladis is 45 years old and a hard working, loving mother. She lives in her own home with her two lovely daughters and her greatest desire is to offer them a better quality of life. Gladis’ grocery store is one of the most shopped in the neighborhood. Her friendliness, charisma, and good service have made her store a favorite among her neighbors and customers who make their purchases early in the morning, because hers is the first store to open and the last to close. What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her neighbors about the things that go on in the neighborhood. She has been doing this for two years and what she finds most challenging is having to remain in her store all day so that her sales don’t drop. In the future she hopes to grow her business so that it becomes the primary outlet in her neighborhood. This will be her second loan though MFP and she knows that if she makes her payments on time, she will be eligible for other loans in the future, and she will also not cause problems for her communal bank. The other members like her very much. She will use the money from this loan to increase her stock of groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mr. Sochea L. (pictured with his wife), is 46 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sary Doung, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and another one attends school. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sochea has been driving a Tuk Tuk (motorcycle) taxi for three years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. The couple is in the process of building new house, but they lack money to finish it. So, Sochea is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 in order to make the finishing touches.

loans.use: To finish his house building.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Mauro, tiene 39 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Mauro nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  brindar servicio de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco y Anta. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar la alimentación y educación de mis hijos. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de mi carro.
texts.en:
Mauro, 39, belongs to the Los Comerciates de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Mauro tells us, "There are 10 members at my community bank and they chose me to talk about my business. I operate a taxi service in the cities of Cusco and Anta. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and so far, so good. With the loans and help that they have given me, I have been able to feed and educate my children. I will use this loan to make some much needed repairs to my cab".

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance for taxi business.

loans.name: Dondy

texts.fr:
Madame Dondy S. Habite dans la localité de Guediawaye. Elle est âgée  de 43 ans. Elle est veuve et mère  de 2 enfants. 
Dans le souci de mener ses propres activités  et disposer de revenus qui  l’aideront à gérer sa famille, madame S.  s’est orientée  dans le  commerce. Ainsi elle s’adonne à l’achat et la vente de mortiers, d’objets d’art et de  tissus au marche Serigne Mansour de Guediawaye. 
Madame S. est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 2003 et a déjà  rembourse 3 prêts  antérieurs.
Elle emprunte 300 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de tissus, thioup, bois et masques destines a la vente. Son objectif est de répondre à la demande  et  satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. En même  temps elle souhaite accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux gérer  sa famille car ses enfants comptent sur elle pour vivre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dondy S. lives in Guediawaye. She is 43-years old, a widow and mother of two children. In order to manage her own activities and earn income that will enable her to take care of her family, Mrs. S. became involved in trade. She buys and sells mortar, artwork and fabrics at the Serigne Mansour market of Guediawaye. Mrs. S. has been a member of the credit union since 2003, and she has already received and repaid three previous loans. She is now seeking a loan of 300,000F CFA to purchase fabrics, thioup (a hand-dyed fabric), wood and masks for resale. Her goal is to meet customer demand and fulfill the needs of her clientele. She would also like to increase her profits to better provide for her family, as her children are dependent on her.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza A. is 44 years old. She is married with two adult children. For almost for 16 years, Firuza has been in the bridal salon business. Every day, she provides services to many brides. In general, she offers bridal dresses and decorations for wedding cars. Her salon is always full of clients, because she does her job professionally. Firuza wants to take a loan to extend her business. She wants to buy additional wedding dresses and decorations. Firuza likes her job very much because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides every day. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods for bridal shop

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle S. is from the town of Talibon. She is 20 years old and married with two infant children. To make a living, Michelle gathers and sells seaweed in the market. Michelle has been in this business for over 3 years.  Michelle recently joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first CEVI loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP, in order to buy nets and other equipment for gathering seaweed.

loans.use: To buy nets and other equipment for gathering seaweed.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman K. (PK-10299) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  She is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Ni Nyoman owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Nyoman has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Nyoman joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nyoman is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK in the amount of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Ni Nyoman plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

She also dreams of seeing all of her sons succeed and for MUK, she hopes than she can get a lower interest rate for next loan--maybe under 1 %.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


  


Ni Nyoman K. (PK-10299) merupakan 48 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nyoman memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Nyoman sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 7 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nyoman menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2010, Ni Nyoman bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Nyoman telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.  Ni Nyoman berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking..

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en: Norma P. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 46 years old. Norma is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Norma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Norma provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Norma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Oyuntungalag K. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and seven year old daughter in Baganuur, a remote district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a rented apartment. Her husband is a driver and works for a mining company at the rural branch of Selenge province. Her daughter attends a local primary school.

Oyuntungalag has been operating a hair and beauty salon in the local community for the past seven years and has gained much experience. In the future, she wants to provide manicure and pedicure services in addition to her hairdressing business. Oyuntungalag is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, "I would like to have my own apartment in the very near future." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary tools and materials such as an electric shearer and hair dye for her business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and materials

loans.name: La Cruz De Yerbateros Group

texts.es:
Personas empeñosas por salir a delante, D. esta manera se denominan las integrantes del grupo  la Cruz D. Yerbateros , grupo conformado por 10 socias que entre el hogar y sus familias ven la forma D. llevar ingresos económicos a sus hogares por medio D. sus negocios.
  Tal así es el caso D. la señora Flor D. María C. D. 40 años D. edad casada y con 2 hijos que dependen D. ella. Hace más D. 7 años se dedica a la venta D. helados en el verano y en el invierno a la venta D. Emoliente el cual es una bebida D. la zona, esto lo hace con el mejor D. los esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante cada día por el bien D. ella y su familia y en el futuro le gustaría tener una heladería mucho mas equipada. Con el reciente préstamo ella implementará su mercadería, comprando productos para la temporada D. verano. Como la señora flor D. María C. el resto D. los integrantes tienen una historia en particular pero, todos coinciden en el esfuerzo y dedicación que brindan todos los días por el bien D. sus familias.
texts.en:
"People who are determined to make progress" - that is what the ten members of this Cruz D. Yerbateros group are known as. They see how to bring income into their homes through their business activities.

Such is the case of Señora Flor D. María C. who is 40 years of age, married and has two dependent children. For over seven years she has been selling ice creams in summer and "emoliente" (a traditional hot drink) in winter. Thus she makes her best effort every day so that she and her family can get on in life. In the future she would like to have a much better equipped ice-cream parlor.  She will use this loan to stock up, buying products for the summer season. 

Like Señora Flor D. María C., the other group members all have their own particular stories, but they all make great efforts and share the same dedication for the good of their families.

loans.use: To stock up, buying products for the summer season.

loans.name: Nene

texts.en:
Nene C. is a married woman who lives in Purok Malipayon, Brgy. Utod, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: pottery making and hog raising. 

Her husband Rodolfo C., who is 54 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 22 to 28 years old. 

Nene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.
