This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her pottery business so that she could continue to save up for future improvements for the business. 

Nene C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund operations of pottery business

loans.name: Steve

texts.en:
Steve G. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 33 years old. Steve is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Steve owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle, or habal-habal, services to local community members. Steve has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Steve joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Steve is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Steve from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Regulo Roberto

texts.es:
Regulo Roberto C. G. tiene 40 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALL PARAISO se encuentra ubicada 120 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Regulo Roberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Matilde Esther y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es esforzarse mucho.

Le gusta leer la sagrada Biblia.
texts.en:
Regulo Roberto C. G., 40, is married.  He lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has four children.

Members of the VALL PARAISO communal bank are located 120 minutes from the Chillanes Office.  It is part of Chillanes canton.  The bank is dedicated to short cycle crop farming, like cocoa beans.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Regulo Roberto has been a cocoa bean farmer for two years.  He buys his products in Matilde Esther and sells at the Chillanes market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his cocoa bean crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and variations in the weather.  His dream is to put in much effort.

He enjoys reading the Holy Bible.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers for cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena G. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 8 children. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice and corn crops. She fattens the pigs she grows and sells them to the market. Magdalena happily shares that she also owns and manages a sari-sari store now. She sells products like sugar, vinegar and other things. 

Magdalena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs, feeds and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, feed and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Brendy Marisol

texts.es:
Brendy tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su madre y a su hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como vendedora en una tienda agrícola de la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente se dedica a la elaboración manual de manteles y muñecas. Ella confecciona sus productos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a las personas que le hace pedidos y también a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad. Con estas actividades ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su hijo y colaborar con la economía de su familia.

La demanda por lo artículos que confecciona ha ido acrecentándose y por ello Brendy ha creído conveniente adquirir más material para ampliar su producción y satisfacer a sus clientes. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Brendy is a 41 year old single mother and lives with her mother and son in one of the towns that form the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a semitropical area that mainly produces fruits such as mango, lemon, and passion fruit. It is in the Piura region and located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works as a saleswoman in an agricultural store in her home area. She also works making table cloths and dolls. She makes her products in her home and sells them by special order and also to the salespeople at the local market. With these jobs she is working to to help her son get ahead and provide for her family.

The demand for her crafts has been increasing and Brendy feels it would be a good idea to buy more supplies to increase her production and satisfy more customers. To help her with this objective she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Supplies for her crafts business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda S. is a hairdresser in Takoradi. Hilda has received junior high school education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a clerk. Hilda has been a hairdresser for three years. She helps her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as capital to expand her business. She hopes to save the profits from her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: Pedro Rafael es un hombre muy trabajador él tiene 2 hijos de 2 años y 14 años actualmente están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, el dio inicio a su negocio por cuenta propia pues es su propia fuente de ingresos que es importante para su familia, es así que el ofrece sus productos en algunos lugares en donde tiene clientes que le realizan pedidos por encargos por lo que trata de hacer todo lo posible por complacerlos. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, shorts, faldas, trajes y ropa para niños. El sueño de él es realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro Rafael is a very hard working man.  He has two children who are 2 and 14 years old in his care.  His economic activity is clothing sales.  He started the business on his own and it is his source of income which is important for his family.  He, therefore, offers his wares in places where he has customers that order items from him and he tries his best to satisfy them.

The financing he’s requesting is for working capital to buy pants, t-shirts, shorts, skirts, suits and children’s clothes.  His dream is to carry out some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Percida's Group

texts.en:
Percida C. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo,Lopez Jaena. She is 41 years old. Percida is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Percida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Percida owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks in the local communiy. Percida has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Percida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Percida C. group is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Percida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Charity

texts.fr: Dame  charity  a  39 ans  et  mère  de  6 enfants.   Elle  habite  quartier  Hédzranawoé.  Elle  fait  le commerce    de tubercules.  Elle  a  commencé  son  activité  en  2008 et  s’approvisionne  à  Atakpamé.  Elle  revend  au  marché  local  de Hédzranawoé.   Elle demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  10 tas  d’igname.
texts.en: Charity is 39 years old and mother to six children. She lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She trades in tubers. She began her activity in 2008 and gets her supplies in Atakpamé. She resells her products at the local market in Hédzranawoé. She is requesting a loan to buy ten piles of yams.

loans.use: Purchase of yams

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame Kossiwa a un enfant et est âgée de 45 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce des  condiments et des œufs. En réalité, elle a commencé son activité en 2001 et s’approvisionne à Koumassi au Ghana.  Elle revient vendre au marché local de Hedzranawoé à Lomé la capitale du Togo. Elle espère accroître son commerce et sollicite au près de wages un crédit.
texts.en: Kossiwa has one child and is 45 years old. In order to be able to contribute to the household, she buys and sells condiments and eggs. She began her business in 2001 and gets her supplies in Koumassi in Ghana. She comes back to sell her products at the local market in Hedzranawoé in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is hoping to expand her business and is requesting a loan from Wages.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and eggs

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza Del Socorro tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad. Tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Comenzó a trabajar en por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso diario, pues debido a su edad no tenía un trabajo y fue así que decide establecer su propio negocio. A pesar de no tener suficiente capital empezó con ciertas cosas como plátanos, repollo, golosinas, refrescos y bolis con el paso del tiempo fue que Esperanza empezó a crecer con su negocio y gracias también a la ayuda de los financiamientos. Con este financiamiento  comprará golosinas, gaseosas, verduras, golosinas, bolis, pan, galletas entre otros. Su sueño es continuar trabajando, para tener un almacén bien abastecido de la mercancía que más se vende en los alrededores de su vivienda.
texts.en: Esperanza Del Socorro has 3 grown-up children.  Her business is a grocery store.  Esperanza started working as she needed to make a daily income.  She didn't have a job owing to her age and so she decided to set up her own business.  In spite of the fact that she didn't have enough capital, she started out selling a few items such as bananas, cabbage, candies, soft drinks and 'bolis' (ice cream treats).  Over time, and with the help of loans, Esperanza began to grow her business.  She will use this current loan to buy candies, soda, vegetables, 'bolis', bread, cookies and other products.  Her dream is to continue working and to have a store that is well stocked with the merchandise that sells best locally.

loans.use: to buy candies, soda, vegetables, 'bolis' (ice cream treats), bread, cookies and other products

loans.name: Freda Cita

texts.en:
Freda Cita A. is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. She is 31 years old. Freda Cita is single. To make a living, Freda Cita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling children's products such as toys & games in the local community. Freda Cita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Freda Cita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Freda Cita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Freda Cita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Freda Cita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for her store.

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en: Rosenia is 44 years old. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Norte. She is married with two children who are age 15 and 17. She works with her husband at their farm and grows rice. This has been her business for 11 years now. The business earns her family P5,000.00/month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, él vive con sus siete hijos y su esposa, sus hijos estudian,Él trabaja la tierra, además vende bananos y leña, por la parte de su esposa pues se dedica a la venta de pupusas.
Él está en proceso de iniciar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos, semillas y herramientas para la poda del terreno, esta inversión será muy útil pues se dotara de las herramientas para llevar a cabo la siembra con un adecuado cuido.
Sus sueños es que sus hijos crezcan saludables, tener una fuente de ingreso que le permita proveerles lo necesario, ya que son varios y se preocupa por que tengan acceso al estudio, que les dé una oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en: Apolinario cultivates corn and beans. He lives with his seven children and his wife. His children are in school and work the land. Additionally they sell bananas and firewood. On the part of his wife, she has a pupusa business. He is in the process of starting his corn and bean plantation, which is why he requests a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and tools for his land. This investment will be very useful because he will be able to supply himself with the tools he needs to provide the maintenance that his plantations need. His dreams are to see his children grow in a healthy way and to have a source of income to provide them with what they need. He has many kids and he is committed to give them access to an education, which will give them an opportunity to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and tools for farming.

loans.name: Kishwer's Group

texts.en:
Kishwer is 50 years old, married and has three sons. Her two elder sons sell vegetables while the youngest one reads in class 2. Her husband also operates a vegetable selling business. His shop is located in the market and he sells good quality fresh vegetables to his clients at reasonable prices. Kishwer herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household work. She is a very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business by purchasing fresh seasonal vegetables. He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and is a very hard-working person. Kishwer is very hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Jenilyn has a retail shop that sells longganiza (homemade sausage) and rice by the kilogram. She has been operating this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for making longganiza and additional sacks of rice.

Jenilyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jenilyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for making longganiza and additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Genoveva has a retail shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to make  barbecue.

Genoveva is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make barbecue

loans.name: Las Animadoras Group

texts.en: Petrona, Ingrid, and Juana, all of whom reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Las Animadoras” solidarity group in June, 2011. Petrona and her husband make a living by selling seafood and vegetables out of their truck. She is a returning client and had a punctual payment history on her previous loan. Petrona is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase a bulk amount of seafood and vegetables, which she will sell. Ingrid makes a living by selling freshly prepared food and Juana makes a living by operating a small convenience shop.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, fish, tomatoes, peppers, carrots, corn, cucumbers, and onions.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is 25 years old and married to Mary who is a fishmonger. They have two school-going children.

He has a livestock business that he has been doing for five years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the money to purchase more livestock. He will use the anticipated profits to provide the family's upkeep and to pay for the children's school fees. 

He hopes in the future to buy a motor vehicle, which will help him to transport the livestock to other markets, and to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él es agricultor y ganadero, inicio con el apoyo de un amigo, y hoy en día posee experiencia y ha logrado mantener a su familia de su esfuerzo.
El tiene el plan de comprarse una novilla, por eso solicita un préstamo, que le permita ampliar el negocio del ganado y aumentar la posibilidades de las ventas.
El propósito de José es mantener en sus tierras mucho ganado, que le permita desarrollarse como ganadero y garantizarle a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and a rancher. Having started this activity with the help of a friend, he nowadays has gained experience and has succeeded in providing for his family with his efforts.
He is requesting a loan because he plans to buy a calf in order to improve the cattle activity and increase his sale chances.
José’s goal is to breed a lot of cattle on his lands, in order to grow as a rancher and to grant his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a small cow.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 40 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboaanga del Norte. She is married and has 3 children.

Dina has been selling fish for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase a fishing machine. Dina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Dina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing machine

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique ha trabajado como independiente desde hace algunos años lo que le ha permitido incluso vincular laboralmente a su familia con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este emprendedor cuenta con un restaurante en el municipio de El Carmen de Víboral al oriente de Antioquia y en el futuro espera crecer para generar empleos a personas de su comunidad. 

Luis, necesita de un préstamo para comprar una moto para realizar domicilios y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique has worked as independently for some years and that has allowed him to bring his family into his work with the objective of improving their quality of life.  This entrepreneur has a restaurant in the town of El Carmen de Viboral in the east of Antioquia.  In the future he hopes to grow so that he can give work to people from his community.

Luis needs a loan to buy a motorbike to make home deliveries and thus increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to make home deliveries

loans.name: Allem

texts.en:
Allem is 43 years old and married.

Allem works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Allem has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending and fruits and vegetables sales.

Allem aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida que son (hamburguesas, chiles rellenos, tacos y tortas). 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio en comprar material que es (carnes, verduras, tortillas y pan, también necesita comprar platos, vasos) no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión ya que tiene un contrato en una compañía para que les entrega platillos de comida todos los días y no quiere desaprovechar esta oportunidad que se le esta presentando para que su negocio tenga un ingreso mas fijo. 
 Doña Veronica es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad un hijo que esta estudiando y quiere que tenga los estudia necesario para su futuro. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio y que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica has had her food preparation and sales business for over ten years.  She makes hamburgers, stuffed chili peppers, tacos and tortas [Mexican sandwiches].

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business buying supplies like meats, vegetables, tortillas and bread; she also needs to buy dishes and glasses.  She does not have the necessary funds to make this investment.  She has a contract with a firm to deliver meals to them daily and she doesn’t want to waste this opportunity for her business to have a more steady income.

Verónica is a single mother with a son in her care who is in school and she wants him to have the necessary schooling for his future.  She plans to repay the loan with profits earned in her business which is her family’s source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. Diosdada is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Diosdada requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 33-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a nearby industrial zone. For the past three years, Anh has run a business making floor mops. She uses the income from her business to cover all her family's living expenses and her children's education fees. 

Anh’s business is going smoothly and she is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of raw materials to increase her production of mops. She hopes that her loan will increase her income, help to improve her living conditions, and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make mops

loans.name: Maribelcy

texts.es:
Con 37 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos, Maribelcy se dedica a la elaboración de comidas para fiestas y eventos; oficio que aprendió luego de que la necesidad la llevó a pensar cómo apoyar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos para la familia. Motivada entonces por este deseo, aprendió a cocinar ayudándole a una amiga y al ver que aprendía muy rápido, decidió embarcarse en la aventura de ser microempresaria.

Además de atender los eventos, esta mujer creativa acude a otras alternativas para obtener el sustento, como lo es la elaboración de empanadas y morcillas que les provee quincenalmente a clientes que ya conocen las mieles de su sazón. 

Contar con muy poco capital para su negocio, no ha sido un obstáculo para mantenerse firme en su intento de salir adelante.  A pesar de ello, en este momento requiere los recursos económicos para comprar un horno e implementos para la cocina.  Realizar esta inversión será clave para mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo y atender con mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
At the age of 37, married and the mother of three children, Maribelcy makes food for parties and events, an occupation she leaned when need forced her to think up a way to help her husband generate family income.  Motivated then by this desire, she learned to cook helping a girlfriend and when she noticed that she was a quick learner she decided to throw herself into the adventure of becoming a micro businesswoman.

Besides catering events, this creative woman turns to other alternatives to obtain income like making empanadas [turnovers] and morcillas [blood sausages] that she sells bi-weekly to customers who are cognizant of her special touch with seasoning.

Having little capital for her business has not been an obstacle for her to stand firm in her intention to get ahead.  Despite that however, at present she needs economic resources to buy an oven and some kitchen utensils.  Making this investment will be key to improving her working conditions and providing better quality for her customers.

loans.use: to buy an oven, pots and various utensils.

loans.name: Chrisoper

texts.en:
Christoper is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He is age 45 and has been in farming for 15 years, with his farm currently producing milk and tea for the local market. He runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income. He is married with one child, aged 6.

Christoper has made a second loan request of 63,600 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will boost his farming income and create employment for his wife as one of his farmhands. He is focusing on increasing his pure breeds in order to earn more from the farming business.

He is, however, concerned with the high fluctuations in milk prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 26 years old, married and has four children who need daily allowances. She was only 19 when she got married. She only finished her high school education and wasn't able to seek employment. 

Luckily, Remalyn and her spouse inherited a hectare plot of land from her in-laws that they have been cultivating for almost three years. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. 

She wants to increase her crop production but she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming.
 
In the future, she would like to ensure good crops and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in rice farming.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, 38, lives with his family in the village of Carikrikan, where he conducts the family's farming activities. Christopher grows agricultural crops, such as rice, on the family-owned 2-hectare plot of land.
Christopher is now requesting a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizer for his farm. He plans to save earned income to purchase furniture for the house, as the family currently has very little.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for his farm.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old and has 4 children aged 10 to 18. All 4 children are in school. She owns a general store which she has been running for 3 years. She would like a loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, and other goods to sell in her shop. Dative will use any profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Alibino

texts.en:
Alibino is a 27-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 1. Two of them go to school. 

Alibino runs a Grinding machine business and he has been in the business for 2 years. He has 1 employee. Alibino heard about Finance Sudan from the loan officers promotion done in the market. He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more items like fuel, some spare parts for the machine and other items. In addition to this business, Alibino has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Alibino would like to buy another machine because it brings in good money. 

His major challenges include the low income rate and the expensiveness of fuel in South Sudan.

Alibino says, "I appreciate finance Sudan’s effort in South Sudan and I love my country."

loans.use: to purchase more items like fuel, some spare parts for the machine and other items.

loans.name: Samuel Ricardo

texts.es: El señor  Samuel  es cliente antiguo que esta en su sexta secuencia de su crédito, Samuel  es viudo tiene una hija, el vive en la ciudad de la paz se dedica en la venta de dvd`s musicales en diferentes zonas de la ciudad de la paz , como ser  zona  sur y  zona central  ambulando por oficinas y en paradas de minibuses y otros lugares comerciales. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes ya que por temporada navideña se dedica a la  venta  de estos productos, el cliente tiene un puesto por navidad sale a vender en la ciudad de La Paz, Samuel  trabaja sacrificadamente todos los días y según la evaluación económica que se lo realizo tiene un negocio rentable. Manifiesta que pagara como siempre puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel is an old client who is in his sixth loan cycle. Samuel is a widower and has a daughter. He lives in the city of La Paz and sells music DVDs in various parts of the city of La Paz, such as in the southern and central zones, passing on foot by offices and at minibus stops and other commercial spots. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of toys since during the Christmas season he devotes himself to selling these products. The client has a stand at Christmas and goes out to sell in the city of La Paz. 

Samuel works devotedly every day of the week and, according to the financial review that was done, he has a profitable business. He states that he will make his payments punctually as he has always done.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Christmas toy merchandise.

loans.name: Jane Atieno

texts.en:
Jane Atieno is a 37 year old boutique owner in Bombolulu, Mombasa. She is single and a mother of two. She has been running this business for the last one year with great success.

This is Jane’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and handbags to resell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and handbags

loans.name: Jobell

texts.en:
Jobell is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jobell is 28 years old and has three children are still in school.

Jobell has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jobell requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing boat.

Jobell has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing nets, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham was born in 1950 in Salyan region. He is married and has 5 children. He has been a vine grower for 20 years. Ilham works very hard for the success of his children. With this business he meets the demands of his family. Now he needs a loan of $500 to buy ferilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara wants to improve her business. She has 3 years of experience in this business. She is 30 and is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region. She is married and has 2 children. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Salimbek

texts.ru:
Salimbek inherited his profession, being a butcher, from his father, who inherited it from his father. Salimbek’s wife stays at home with their 2 small children. Salimbek’s parents also live with him. Once a year during apricot-drying season, his family dries apricots. The biggest portion of the family’s income comes from Salimbek’s butchery business. He purchases livestock at the local markets and then sells the meat in the village market. Salimbek has been doing business with “MicroInvest” for 6 months. Currently, he is planning to get a loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Салимбек унаследовал от отца его профессию – мясника, которая осталась отцу Салимбека от его отца. Жена Салимбека нигде не работает, у него 2 маленьких сына, и его родители живут вместе с ним. Раз в год в сезон сушки абрикосов его семья сушит абрикосы. Большая часть семейного дохода складывается от мясничества. Скот приобретает на местных базарах и реализует на базарах по кишлакам. В Микроинвест кредитуется в течении полгода. В данный момент собирается получить новый займ для расширения своей деятельности.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Maimuna Ibrahimo Uss

texts.pt:
Maimuna sells paintings to tourists who visit the city of Inhambane, which is a zone with great tourism potential. She is married and has 3 children. They joined the credit program in 2006. She initially took a loan of $200 to invest in her business selling paintings to tourists. Since the business went well, she decided to sell soft drinks and cigarettes as well. She also managed to do work onher home. All her children are studying.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Maimuna vende quadros pintaodos para os turistas que visitam a cidade de Inhambane que e uma zona com um grande potencial turistico.Ela e casada e tem 3 filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela tomou inicialmente$200 para investir no seu negocio de venda de quadros aos turista. Porque o negocio corria bem ela resolveu vender tambem refrigerantes e cigarros. Conseguiu tambem reabilitar a residencia dela. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar.

loans.use: Purchase of more paintings and more boxes of soft drinks

loans.name: Elvira Azucena

texts.es:
Elvira has had her own salon for around 37 years. It's located in a local market in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. Elvira struggled to start her business with only two chairs and a mirror. Since opening it, she has dedicated body and soul to the salon, and that dedication has made it one of the best in the market. Elvira is married with six children and five grandchildren, and is very happy to have successfully grown her business on her own and with the help of CEPRODEL, a micro-loan institution she has worked with for approximately three years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Negocio propio tiene de existir alrededor de 37 años. Está ubicado en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de la ciudad de Managua.

Doña Elvira empezo su negocio apenas con dos sillas y un espejo. Desde sus inicion se dedico a su negocio en cuerpo y alma, y esta dedicacion la que la llevo a destacarse entre los mejores salones del mercado.Casada, con siete hijos y cinco nietos se siente muy dichosa de haber logrado crecer con su propio esfuerzo y la ayuda de CEPRODEL, institucion con la que trabaja desde hace aproximadamente 3 años.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and improve conditions her salon

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es:
Isolda Graciela is 47 years old, a single mother and lives in the 3-80 district of Managua. She manages a small Internet Café and in this way she has been able to advance. The construction of her house has cost her a lot of money and she is the only source of financial support for her family. She now needs a loan to build a room, which is not in the best condition, so that she can make her daughter more comfortable and continue to improve her humble abode.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Isolda Graciela tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua. Trabaja como administradora de un pequeño Café Internet y es así como ha logrado salir adelante. La construcción de su casa le ha costado mucho ya que ella es el único sostén de su familia. En la actualidad necesita el crédito para la construcción de un cuarto, el cual no presta las mejores condiciones de habitación y poder brindarle comodidad a su hija, e ir mejorando su humilde vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is very pleased with what he's been able to achieve through his business of buying and selling lambswool. He learned and inherited this trade from his parents, who were very successful in the field. Hugo buys his merchandise at street fairs in small towns like Tiquillaca, Vilquechico, Mañazo, etc. After reaching a considerable volume, he sells it in bulk to a textile company, which earns him a decent profit. Hugo did not have a chance to have his own family, but that void has been filled by his adorable nephews, for whom he has special affection, and he would like to support them in obtaining their higher education. He is seeking a loan to purchase larger quantities of lambswool in order to increase his earnings. Hugo hopes to receive your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer

Hugo, se siente muy feliz por lo que está logrando conseguir con su negocio de compra y venta de lana de oveja. Esta actividad la aprendió y heredó de sus padres, quienes fueron los mejores comerciantes en este rubro. Hugo compra su mercadería en las ferias de los pueblitos de Tiquillaca, Vilquechico, Mañazo, etc. y luego de albergar un considerable volumen las vende por grandes cantidades a una empresa textil por lo que obtiene buenas ganancias.Hugo no tuvo la oportunidad de formar su familia, pero ese vació lo llenan sus adorables sobrinos por quienes siente un cariño especial y desea apoyarlos con sus estudios superiores. Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad a fin de incrementar sus ganancias.Hugo en este momento espera por vuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of wool

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Simpir

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Sampir (49) lives alone all her life. Despite being unmarried, she diligently supports herself through breeding pigs. At the start of her business, Ni Nyoman Sampir used her own savings to build a permanent pigpen and buy 2 sows. After mating, each sow bore 8 piglets within 3 months. Two months later, each piglet was sold for $25. Looking at this encouraging result, Ni Nyoman Sampir was very excited and wanted to expand her business. This time, she will need some fund to build another pigpen and buy more sows. Ni Nyoman Sampir also plans to hire someone to help her when her business is growing. She will be thrilled and proud of herself when that day comes because, not only that she will grow her income, but also will she provide employment opportunities for others.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Simpir, 49 tahun, hidup seorang diri hingga usianya yang sekarang ini. Walaupun tidak mempunyai suami, ia tetap tekun dalam menjalani hidup dan usahanya, yakni beternak babi. Awal mula usahanya, Ni Nyoman Simpir bermodalkan dengan tabungannya sendiri. Dari modal tabungan tersebut, ia bisa membuat kandang babi yang permanen dan membeli 2 induk babi. Setelah induk babinya itu dikawinkan, selama 3 bulan berikutnya induk babi tersebut melahirkan dengan jumlah anak per ekornya sebanyak 8 ekor anak babi. Selama pemeliharaan 2 bulan, anak babi tersebut bisa dijual dengan harga per ekornya adalah Rp. 250.000.- Melihat hasil yang didapatnya, Ni Nyoman Simpir sangat antusias dan berencana untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Saat ini ia membutuhkan dana untuk membuat kandang babi lagi dan sekaligus membeli induk babi. Ni Nyoman Simpir juga berencana untuk mengajak seorang tenaga kerja untuk membantunya nanti kalau usaha nanti bisa berkembang. Ni Nyoman Simpir merasa senang dan bangga kalau nanti usaha bisa berkembang, ia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak lagi dan sekaligus menyediakan lapangan pekerjaan bagi sesamanya.

loans.use: To buy sows and build pigpen

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
In the municipality of El sauce of the city of León lives the gentleman, Diego F., who is dedicated to the business of farming, having his small cattle on his farms which allows him to maintain his family in the condition that they deserve. From his youth he has been dedicated to this business. Being the head of the house and seeing the need for electric power to live in a rural zone, he requests the installation of a solar panel that will permit him to obtain electric power for the lighting of the home and to carry out the tasks of the house.

Once the solar panel is installed in their home, Diego will repay the loan. For this reason he seeks support from Ceprodel. They need your support to allow them to give him the loan and to give him the benefit of electric power in order to carry out the daily tasks of the home and also so that his children can study in the afternoons and the nights.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El sauce de la ciudad de León habita el caballero Diego F. dedicándose al negocio agropecuario teniendo su pequeño ganado en sus fincas con el que permite mantener su familia en las condiciones que esta se merece. Desde joven se ha dedicado a este negocio y por ser la cabeza del hogar al ver la necesidad de no tener energía eléctrica por vivir en una zona rural, solicita la instalación de un panel solar que le permita obtener energía eléctrica para la iluminación del hogar y llevar a cabo los quehaceres de la casa.

Una vez con el panel solar instalado en su hogar de habitación, el señor Diego debe de pagar tal deuda y por este motivo busca apoyo en Ceprodel para recibir apoyo con crédito que le permita salir de esta deuda y sacarle el provecho a la energía eléctrica para realizar los quehaceres diarios del hogar y además para que sus hijos puedan estudiar por las tardes y las noches.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel for his home, so that he can carry out the daily work of the house and so that his children can study in the afternoons and nights.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 62 years old and lives and works in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. He makes a living selling a variety of items, including fruits, vegetables and carpets. He is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy various types of merchandise to sell to his customers

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.id:
Nyoman S. manages a restaurant and shop that sells rice (both cooked for a meal or to purchase dry in bulk). Her business has already grown because her first loan from Kiva allowed her to increase her inventory. She would like to receive a second loan to lease an additional place to sell rice. In addition to selling rice, she also sells fuel. The money she brings in is enough to lighten the day-to-day burdens on her family. She currently lives with her husband in a single rented room on Tegal Jaya Street in Denpasar, Bali.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Warung nasi yang dikelola Nyoman sekarang sudah berkembang sebab dari pinjaman pertama dia bisa menambah barang-barang dagangannya. Rencananya pinjaman periode ke 2 ini akan dipakai sebagai modal untuk menyewa tempat lagi untuk jualan nasi. Selain jealan nasi, sehari-hari juga Nyoman berjualan bensin eceran. Keuntungan dari usahanya cukup untuk menambah mengurangi beban keluarga. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama suaminya di Jl.Tegal Jaya Denpasar dengan menyewa sebuah kamar.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama D. is 54 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She takes care of the school fees of her children who are at school in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To earn money for her expenses, she makes and sells bread at the roadside. With her first loan from FECEVAV, Ama wishes to buy bags of wheat flour and sugar, and have a new oven built in order to satisfy the demands of her ever-increasing clientele. With the profit she will make from sales, she will be able to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Ama D. est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle supporte les charges scolaires de ses enfants qui sont à l’école à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour gagner de l’argent pour ses dépenses, elle prépare et vend du pain au bord de la route. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, Ama souhaite acheter des sacs de farine de blé, du sucre et se faire contruire un nouveau four pour satisfaire la demande de la clientèle qui ne cesse de croître. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Meri Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ms. Meri del Pilar is a 31-year-old woman who has been selling sweets as a street vender for several years. She has 3 children, who are her motivation to work on a daily basis. She would like to see them become professionals in the near future. Her partner, Edgar, lovingly supports all the decisions she makes. Meri del Pilar would like to increase her candy sales and one day sell candy wholesale so that she can earn a better living, which is why she needs a loan to purchase merchandise and make home improvements. Support Ms. Meri del Pilar because she is a hardworking and honorable person who promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Meri del Pilar tiene 31 años y se dedica a la venta de golosinas de manera ambulatoria hace ya varios años, ella tiene 3 hijos que son el motivo de su trabajo diario, desea verlos en un futuro cercano profesionales. Su pareja, Edgar, la apoya cariñosamente en las decisiones que toma. Meri del Pilar quiere crecer con la venta de golosinas, y más adelante desea hacerlo al por mayor y desde luego tener un ingreso económico mejor al actual, es por ello que necesita del préstamo que solicita para la compra de nueva mercadería y a su vez mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Apoya a la señora Meri del Pilar, ella es trabajadora y honorable, promete que no te defraudará.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort has been selling used clothes for the past five years in the market of Obuasi, Ghana. She relies on the income she makes from her sales to support her household by providing food and paying utility bills. Comfort is a wife and mother of four kids, who are in school. She requests the loan to enable her to inject more capital into the business to purchase more bales of used clothes. She hopes she will be able to increase her savings to support her kids' education. She is a member of the group called Progress Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Абдуназарова Розия жительница района Хуросон. Возраст 32 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Клиентка занимается выращиванием овощей. Помогает ей ее муж.После сбора урожая Розия реализует его на месном рынке по выгодной ей цене.Этот вид деятельности помогает ей  содержать свою семью.В данный момент клиентка хочет купить семена и саженцы овощей.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Roziya A. lives in the Khuroson district. She is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. She grows vegetables with the help of her husband. She sells her harvest at a local market for profit. This business helps her support her family. Currently, Roziya wants to purchase seeds and vegetable seedlings. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen además de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de ropa ofrece entre sus clientes productos de belleza para tener así un ingreso mas para poder costear la educación de sus hijos, comenzó hace 4 años su negocio cuando una de sus amigas le invito a vender estos productos y al ver que tenia buenas ganancias acepto dedicarse a a esto.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para incrementar sus productos y ofrecer variedad de ellos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda ella seguirá progresando.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen besides dressmaking and selling of clothes, she offers among her clients beauty products for sale. She wants to be able to finance the education of her children. She started her business 4 years ago when one of her friends invited her to sell these products and after seeing she could get good profits, she decide to sell them.

She needs a loan of $200, which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, to offer a bigger variety to her clients and increase her inventory. With your help she will be able to succed.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sophai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophai H., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sol Sen, 32, live in a small village located 15 kms from Phnom Penh. Married in 2007, they take care of two daughters from her husband's first marriage.

Mrs. Sophai has been a silk weaver from a very early age, learning the skill from a villager near her commune. She sells her finished products to the trader in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for five years. Sophai is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: They

texts.en: Mrs. They C. lives in Krodas Kor Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a 57-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are farmers while two are fishermen and the remaining one is attending the local school. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on her crop so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: They Chay would like to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank.  Maria, 55, is married, and has seven children. Maria travels to different markets around the Ayacucho Region twice a week to sell fruits, vegetables, and dry goods. She buys animals like cows at these regional markets to resell in the San Juan Bautista Sunday Market in the city of Ayacucho.  Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and soda. Maria dreams of opening a large store in her home, so that she won’t have to travel any more. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Maria es casada, tiene 55 años y 7 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región D. Ayacucho, 2 veces por semana en donD. venD. frutas, verduras, abarrotes y D. las ferias compra animales como ganado vacuno, que luego venD. en la feria D. San Juan Bautista. 
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, gaseosas. 
Maria sueña con tener una tienda granD. en su casa y no tener que viajar mas.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta. and soda

loans.name: Odiyi

texts.en: Odiyi N. is a hard-working young lady. She has a boutique where she sells male and female clothes, bags, and shoes. She has been in this business since 2005. She is a dedicated client of  LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes to increase her profit margin. She is 32 years old and single. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny E. D. G., tiene 50 años, vive en   La Urb. Libertad, Distrito Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Curso hasta 5to D. primaria, dejo los estudios debido a que se inclino mas por el trabajo, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 03 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. menú, inicio su negocio vendiendo verduras en un mercado donD. estuvo durante 25 años hasta que la botaron por ser ambulante, también con la venta D. animales menores, el mismo que abandono cuando sufrió el robo D. todos sus animales., con las ganancias que obtuvo opto por dedicarse a la venta D. menú, negocio que si le deja ganancias y desarrolla en su propio domicilio
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Cielo II”, lo invirtió en la compra animales menores para la venta.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra alimentos D. primera necesidad para su negocio D. menú.
Marleny sueña con tener un restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Marleny E. D. G. is 50 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up to the 5th year of primary school, but did not continue as she was more inclined to work. She has five children, three of whom still depend on her financially. She dedicates herself to selling prepared foods, having started her business selling vegetables at a market until she was asked to leave after 25 years there. She also sold small livestock, an activity she stopped after all her animals were stolen. With her earnings, she opted to dedicate herself instead to food sales. This business, which she runs out of her home, does proviD. her with an income. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Cielo II”, she invested in the purchase of young animals to sell. With this loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for her business. Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food preparation business.  Marleny dreams of one day opening a restaurant in her house.

loans.name: Zeca Francisco

texts.pt:
Zeca Francisco C. é natural da província de Sofala no centro do pais, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente e pai de 5nfilhos com idades entre 29; 24; 15; 9 e 3 anos respectivamente, apenas sustenta 4 filhos dado que o primeiro já tem sua casa e trabalha assalariado.

Zeca estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai, aos 22 anos de idade mudou se da zona quando se incorporou nos serviços militar obrigatório tendo lhe levado até a província do Maputo, em 1992 foi desmobilizado assim recebe mensalmente uma pensão militar.

Zeca trabalha como guarda com um horário das 7h as 18h, tem um salário mensal de 6000,00mt, vive numa casa própria, este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. assim pretende pagar antes doo tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Zeca Francisco C. was born in the central province of Sofala. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 5 children aged 29, 24, 15, 9, and 3 respectively. He supports 4 of his children, since the oldest already has his own house and a job with a salary. Zeca went to school until the 4th grade and then stopped when he lost his father. When he was 22 years old he left home because he was drafted into military service, which took him to Maputo. In 1992 he left the military service and now receives a monthly military pension. Zeca works as a guard from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and receives a monthly salary of 6000.00 MT. He lives in his own house, and this is his second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He intends to pay off this loan ahead of time so that he can request another loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Норова Дильбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Ей одной приходится обеспечивать семью , так как муж почти не присылает деньги. Сама клиентка работает в магазине , где торгует косметикой и одеждой. Кредит ей необходим для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar N. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 49 years old, married and has six children. Her husband left to earn a living in the Russian Federation. However, because he barely sends any money home, Dilbar now has to support her family. She works at store where she sells cosmetics and clothing. Dilbar needs this loan in order to increase her goods turnover. She can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Бадалов Насриддин житель района Шахринау. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет пятерых детей.Работает таксистом по маршруту Шахринау-Душанбе-Шахринау.Кроме того занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Для этого вида бизнеса планирует получить кредит . Планирует купить породистогобычка , который в дальнейшем сможет давать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Nasriddin B. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 44 years old, married and has five children. He works as a taxi driver on the Shahrinav-Dushanbe route. Besides this, he is involved in sales of cattle. It is for this business that Nasriddin plans to obtain the loan. He plans to purchase a purebred bull in order to subsequently provide for a purebred breed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a purebred bull

loans.name: Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en: A. Razaq is the group leader of the A. Razaq group.  They have three members. They want to take a loan of 44100 Afghani for 10 months.  A. Razaq wants to take a loan for his computer making shop.  Palwasha wants a loan for tailoring.  Ma J. wants a loan for the business of leather work.  They admire this process so much.

loans.use: Buy business supplies.

loans.name: Mirzobahodur

texts.ru: Рофиев Мирзобаходур парень- студент пятого курса ВУЗа города Худжанда, заочного отделения. Мирзобаходур имеет свой доход с купли продажи мобильных телефонов. Он покупает рабочие исправные телефоны и отремонтировав их перепродаёт с наценкой. У него место деятельности находится на рынке Худжанда, он арендует маленький ларёк где ведёт свою работу.
texts.en:
Mirzobahodur R. is a young man who is a fifth-year student in the distance learning program at an institution of higher learning in the city of Khujand. Mirzobahodur has his own income from buying and selling mobile phones. He purchases working phones in good repair and, once they have been refurbished, resells them at a markup. His sales outlet is located at the Khujand market, where he rents a small stall to conduct his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Telephone sales

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past 8 years, Luisa has operated her family-run pet supply business out of the weekend flea market in San Jose with help from her husband Garrett and, occasionally, their teenage daughter. Luisa currently specializes in bird cages and accessories, toys and supplies for dogs, and cages, food and supplies for hamsters, guinea pigs and rabbits. 

Recently, when the aquatic supply business next door to Luisa’s shut down, Luisa decided to jump at the chance to expand her business and begin selling fish and aquatic life merchandise. But buying all the inventory for the new product line is expensive and she also needs a new store awning and sign to better advertise her store. A $3,500 loan will help Luisa purchase the new inventory and the new signage and awning and greatly increase her store’s sales and foot traffic.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Luisa from  United States

loans.use: Purchase of awning for storefront and inventory

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха – женщина 46 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей парфюмерии и декоративной косметики, а также женской обуви на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. У Солихи очень большой ассортимент товара и соответственно у нее много клиентов. Солиха закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков и индивидуальных дистрибьюторов а также ездит на оптовый рынок города Истаравшан. Сейчас современная молодёжь предпочитает дорогую косметику известных компаний. Поэтому Солиха просит займ для закупки партию декоративной косметики от Российской компании Эйвон и партию женской летней обуви.
texts.en:
Soliha is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells perfumes and decorative cosmetics, and also women’s shoes at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Soliha has a wide assortment of merchandise and, thus, has many customers. She buys her merchandise from supplier firms and individual distributors. She also travels to a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Nowadays, modern young people prefer expensive cosmetics from well-known companies. This is why Soliha is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of decorative cosmetics from a Russian company, Avon, and a stock of women’s summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and women's summer shoes

loans.name: Lucila Petronila

texts.es:
La Señora Lucila Petronila G. P. D. D. tiene 46 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 2º D. secundaria, ya que por escasos recursos económicos tuvo que dejar D. estudiar y empezar a trabajar en el campo. Tiene 5 hijos pero solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella, porque se encuentran estudiando en la universidad.
Lucila se dedica a la crianza D. cerdo, carnero, reses y ala venta D. sus carnes en el mercado D. Moche.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, compro cuyes, los que crió y posteriormente vendió.
Este crédito D. 1500 soles servirá para comprar cerdos, patos, pollos y cuyes. Lucila sueña con aumentar la crianza D. sus animales para que pueda vender con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Lucila Petronila G. P. D. D. is 46 years old and lives in the district of Moche, Trujillo province, Department of La Libertad, in Peru. She studied until her second year of high school, when she had to leave school and begin working in the fields because of the lack of economic resources. She has 5 children, but only two depend upon her, because they are university students.

Lucila raises pigs, rams, and other animals, and sells meat in the Moche market. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought guinea pigs, which she raised and then sold. She will use this loan of 1500 PEN to buy pigs, ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. Lucila dreams of increasing the number of animals she raises so that she can sell more often.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Saidat Muyanja ‘S Group

texts.en:
Saidat is the leader of four members of a group.  She is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 21 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-room house where she is staying with five people. Saidat takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Saidat stays in Nalukolongo selling bananas in Nalukolongo Market, in one of Kampala suburbs.  She doesn’t incur any extra transport cost as she buys from her place of work.  Saidat sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and daily market dues.  She has been in this business for the last ten years. Saidat has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her 14th loan, working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy to more bananas. Saidat aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced and has three kids, all of whom are in school in the community where they live. She is 49 years old and runs a clothing shop where, for the past four years, she has sold jeans-clothes, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dress-bags. She mostly sells through hawking (going door-to-door) in the nearby communities during their market days.

As a single mother, Elizabeth is constrained by funds to run her business and to meet her family needs in the way she expects. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into her business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase a large quantity of good quality items to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more jeans-clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un homme de 30 ans marié et père de deux enfants. Il  habite à Kpadape un village situé à 10 kilomètres de kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, koffi voulait acheter du  sucre, du citron, bissape, ananas etc… pour en faire des boissons non alcoolisées. Avec les bénéfices qu’il obtiendra, Koffi rêve de tenir une grande boutique à Lomé pour vendre du poisson.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is 30 years old, married and father of two children. He lives in Kpadape, a village situated 10 kilometres from Kpalimé. With this loan, Koffi would like to buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc. with which to make non-alcoholic drinks. With the income he will earn, Koffi dreams of having a large shop in Lomé from where he can sell fish.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, lemons, hibiscus, pineapples etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter des fertilisants

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., 25 and her husband, Mr. Phally Heng, 27, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and 1 daughter. One of them attends school and other one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap has been a weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor Korol' is married with two daughters. He is a businessman from Kahovka. He runs a business offering shoe repair services at two locations in his home town. Viktor was forced to start this enterprise after the collapse of Soviet Union when his family had many financial needs. He has been in this trade for 15 years. His working capital amounts to 18,000 UAH. Monthly net profit is about 5,500 UAH.  

Viktor is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional raw materials and supplies for his shoe repair business. Viktor likes his work and is hoping to see his venture grow further and expand even more. Viktor is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe his commitment to his venture and personal characteristics will help him repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for his business.

loans.name: Ceril

texts.en: Ceril L. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan. She is 33 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Ceril owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ceril joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Ceril is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
As the father of four children, Ravshan decided to start looking to start the kind of business that could yield enough money to support his wife and family for the long term, particularly so that his children can finish their studies. For this reason, he took what little savings he had and started his own bread “lepeshka,” a bakery business at home. With only a few utensils and clients but with faith and enthusiasm, he has made his business successful by growing a loyal clientele little by little. However, Ravshan wishes to offer his clients better services so that they do not seek other competing businesses. He also wants to be able to attract more clients. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD. With this money, Ravshan will be able to buy more products for making lepeshka and will be able to make improvements to his offerings. With these improvements, Ravshan expects to attract more clients and will be capable of supporting his family and continuing to fund his children’s studies. His goal is to be able to offer a better future to his family.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for the baking of lepeshka.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells used clothes and natural medicine to her customers at retail prices. She lives Warri, Delta State. She is 35 years old and married, and she has 2 children.. She is a hard-working woman. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She is hoping for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more natural medicines to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et qui  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. Les prêts antérieurs ont été tous bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de chaussures, de pomme de terre, de condiments alimentaires, de l’essence etc  et de la restauration. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 douzaines de chaussures, 5 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 6 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 250 litres d’essence et  2 sacs de 100kg de riz + 4 paquets 5 paquets de condiments pour faire la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Médine et de Hamdallaye, de façon ambulante  dans les quartiers et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.250FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent demander plus de capitaux pour aménager leur point de vente et mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Sabougnouma are essentially married women who average 43 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  These women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers and are now on their fifth solidarity loan.  The previous loans have all been repaid.  The group members sells shoes, potatoes, condiments, gasoline, etc., and they work in food service.
